job_title: Program Experience Coordinator, Venture Café Miami - Miami, FL
job_html:
Do you thrive working on programs and events with impact? Are you looking to make a difference in your start-up community? Do you want to help connect entrepreneurs, students, researchers, creatives, corporates and investors to make things happen? Yes? Then you belong at Venture Café!  

At Venture Café we believe that one day, across the world, ​we will all participate equally in the process of innovation​ - making our world a better place​. To achieve this purpose we are building a global community of innovators ​that provides​ open access to capital in a multitude of ways; human, social, economic, intellectual and political, to solve our community’s most pressing challenges. 

That’s exactly why we need you. Are you ready to help us make an impact?  


ABOUT VENTURE CAFÉ MIAMI
Venture Café Miami was founded in 2016 and has built a strong reputation in Miami as an ecosystem leader - cultivating a community of over 50,000 engaged and supportive innovators.  

Venture Café Miami has facilitated over 3,400 hours of educational sessions and established 1,000 partnerships for a diverse demographic of over 70% people of color and 49% women.  

At Venture Café Miami, we partner with companies and organizations that are evolving business, education, technology, social justice, science and the arts within Miami and beyond. The weekly Thursday Gathering  convenes hundreds of creative, resourceful people who are just as invested in improving life on this planet as you are.  


ABOUT VENTURE CAFÉ GLOBAL INSTITUTE (VCGI)
Venture Café Miami is part of the growing Venture Café Global Institute (VCGI), and that means you will be, too!  

What began in 2009 as a simple idea within the Cambridge Innovation Center (CIC) in Massachusetts to better connect people, ideas and resources soon became a movement. Today, Venture Café helps change-makers connect to opportunities locally and globally in Boston, St. Louis, Rotterdam, Miami, Tokyo, Philadelphia, Sydney, Providence, Warsaw, Phoenix, and Monterrey, with more sites in development! 

Since 2009, Venture Café has convened over 550,000 innovators, creatives, developers and civic-minded leaders around the world, building a global community of communities.  

At VCGI, we believe if we’re going to solve humankind’s biggest challenges, we need as many entrepreneurs and innovators as possible involved in that process.  


YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
We are looking for a curious doer to join our fun team to coordinate an impactful program for a community of innovators at the Venture Café’s flagship weekly event, the Thursday Gathering. 

The role of the Program Experience Coordinator is to support the execution of the Thursday Gathering, including the following:
• Program and speaker coordination before, during and after the event.
• Web, email and Social event promotion on Venture Café Miami communication channels.
• Track and measure program engagement and community experience, extracting insights for improvements. 
• Coordination of local Venture Café Ambassadors to assist the Thursday Gatherings.
• Connect with the Venture Café Global Institute to share learnings to support the relationship between Venture Café Miami and its global counterparts.
• Identify and mitigate risks to the effective operation of the Thursday Gathering.
• Collaborate with the awesome CIC St. Miami team to ensure a delightful event experience. 

Physical activities on the job: Frequent use of hands for fine motor work and mid to full vision. This position regularly includes hosting events in our spaces, necessitating moving around our spaces and lifting/moving AV equipment, tables, and chairs. This position also requires significant time working on a computer and navigating between different documents and platforms.


ABOUT YOU
You have experience creating marketing campaigns, coordinating programs and events and bringing a creative, flexible approach to your work. You have a long-term commitment and passion for mission driven work, which will give you the drive to deliver successful events and gatherings for Venture Café  Miami. 

Your strong customer service focus and ability to problem solve will set you up for success in this position. You are comfortable with failure and committed to improvement, with a relentless, obsessive attention to detail. 

More specifically, you thrive in:
• Executing events or programs activities.
• Creating content for social media and email marketing.
• Envisioning, developing and implementing innovative program experiences.
• Connecting with a broad cross-section of the community. 
• Utilizing space in creative and engaging ways.
• Communicating and promoting programs through digital media channels.  


YOU HAVE
• Availability to work at the weekly Venture Café Thursday Gathering from 3-8 pm.
• Comfort in Google Apps and a willingness to learn customized Salesforce and WordPress platforms.
• Strong writing skills and experience managing social media platforms such as Instagram, LinkedIn and Twitter.
• Comfort speaking in a formal and informal setting.
• An interest in Miami’s start-up community, key influencers, networks and organizations.
• Awareness of and sensitivity to a diverse range of stakeholders.
• Excellent organizational, customer service, communication and problem-solving skills.

If you don't meet all the requirements or qualifications but bring some other unique skills and experience that would be valuable in this role, please apply and highlight those attributes for us in your cover letter.  


OUR OFFER

• 100% company paid premium healthcare and dental benefits.
• 100% company paid long and short-term disability, and life insurance.
• 401k (must be 21+).
• Two weeks of vacation (more with seniority) plus thirteen holidays from the start.

job_title: President, Venture Café Global Institute - Global
job_html:
The Venture Cafe Global Institute (VCGI) is an international organization that convenes gatherings of entrepreneurs, scientists, investors and other innovators every Thursday in eleven cities around the world. 

VCGI seeks a skilled President interested in leveraging the Venture Cafe platform to expand the number of cities it operates in and deepen its programming with the goal of helping foster new innovative enterprises and collaborations.

If you think you are the right person to lead this organization, and to help make the world better through innovation by building stronger innovation communities, we would like to speak with you.

Notice to professional recruiting firms: VCGI is interested in identifying a recruiting firm with expertise in roles like this who can help us extend our reach for this search.  If you believe your firm has the requisite skills, please don't hesitate to reach out to us.


ABOUT VENTURE CAFÉ
The objective of Venture Café weekly gatherings is to build a community of business founders and teams that drives regional economic development through business formation and growth. The weekly gatherings strive to achieve this objective by using a mixture of networking, mentoring, and engaging educational programming. 

Today, there are Venture Cafés in Cambridge (Massachusetts), St. Louis (Missouri), Rotterdam (The Netherlands), Miami (Florida), Tokyo (Japan), Philadelphia (Pennsylvania), Sydney (Australia), Providence (Rhode Island), Warsaw (Poland), Phoenix (Arizona), and Monterrey (Mexico). Multiple additional locations are in the works, and we hope to support the creation of dozens more.

VCGI has a direct, central staff of 5. Together with the teams at each cafe location, approximately 98 people operate the Venture Café platform around the world.  

In the cities in which we operate we quickly become the largest, best known, and best attended regular gathering of innovators and entrepreneurs.  Through these gatherings, and other programs and activities of our cafes, we aim to increase the level of innovation and entrepreneurship in our cities.  

Since 2009, we have convened in total over 550,000 innovators, creatives, developers and civic-minded leaders around the world, building a global community of entrepreneurs and innovators that provides​ open access to capital in a multitude of ways; human, social, economic, intellectual and political capital. The sectors serviced and businesses formed range from high tech innovations to less tech enabled services

Each Venture Café location is typically funded by local leading innovation players: universities, consortia, governmental agencies, and operators of innovation-focused buildings and districts. Individual cafes may either be directly owned and operated by VCGI, or may be a licensee operating under VCGI guidelines and frameworks.

VCGI, legally the "CIC Venture Cafe Global Institute", is structured as a Delaware public benefit company (PBC) which reinvests all of its income in its mission. It was founded by Tim Rowe and incubated by Cambridge Innovation Center (a global operator of shared workspaces for innovators it calls innovation campuses). Later, it was spun out as a separate organization. CIC remains a close strategic partner and sponsor. CIC’s collaboration includes space donation for events within its locations as well as payroll and benefits administration at some locations, and direct management support for local Venture Cafe teams in others.

VCGI is funded by an annual USD $45K fee paid into the center by each local cafe.  It provides the member cafes guidance, service and support to the network, much like the secretariat of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies.


ABOUT THE ROLE
VCGI seeks a dynamic, creative, and energetic leader as its President. This person will manage all aspects of the organization including but not limited to finance, operations, fundraising/development, leadership/personnel, evaluation, and programs — often with limited guidance. 
 
This is a senior leadership position that will report to a Board composed of Tim Rowe (Founder and CEO of CIC) and Melissa Ablett-Jordaan (COO of CIC).


YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
You will be responsible for leading the Venture Café Global Institute team as well as the Executive Leadership team (Executive Directors at each local Venture Café) of the Venture Café Network.  You will set the vision and strategy for the organization’s work while growing a mission driven and  financially sustainable organization. 
 
You will need to:
• Collaborate with the Board and stakeholder partners in each Venture Café city to refine and implement the strategic plan while ensuring that the budget, staff, and priorities are aligned with VCGI’s core mission.
• Provide inspirational leadership and direction to all executives, ensure the continued development and management of a professional and efficient organization, and establish effective decision-making processes that will enable VCGI to achieve its long- and short-term goals and objectives.
• Cultivate a strong and transparent working relationship with local stakeholders and the networks to ensure open communication about the measurement of financial, programmatic, and impact performance against stated milestones and goals.
• Build a diverse and inclusive workforce, representative of the community at each location, that is highly engaged and willing to leverage and secure resources.
• Ensure that the flow of funds (the combination of fees from member cafes, partners with whom we collaborate, and external sources) permits VCGI to make continuous progress towards the achievement of its mission and that those funds are allocated properly to reflect present needs and future potential.
• Formulate and execute comprehensive external communications/marketing, branding and development strategies that will ensure consistency throughout the organization and enhance revenue from major donors, foundations, government agencies, and corporations.
• Ensure the delivery of high-quality services while managing for current and future growth.
• Facilitate cross-member collaboration and strengthen internal communications with teams throughout the organization; create and promote a positive, multicultural work environment that supports consistency throughout the organization's strategy, operational methods, and data collection needs.
• Achieve a healthy financial status for the organization, including developing long and short range financial plans, monitoring the budget and ensuring sound financial controls are in place; set financial priorities accurately to ensure the organization is operating in a manner that supports the needs of the program and staff.
• Rationalize the delivery of programs through new and existing offices and partnerships.
• Target new locations for Venture Café and work with the regional stakeholders to propose a program and attract funding for launch and long term sustainability. Hire and train the staff for these new Venture Cafés.

 
QUALITIES WE SEEK IN YOU
Venture Café has become a deeply loved, integral part of every innovation community in which we operate.  We seek a strong leader who understands the trust these communities have placed in us, and who is prepared to lean in to invent new and better ways to connect and support innovators, in large part by spreading the learnings at each cafe to the others. We expect you to be the public face of Venture Café globally, and to champion the growth of our network of innovation ecosystems. 

We envision that you will: 
• Possess strong relationship building skills and the ability to be the face of the Venture Café brand and community. 
• Be a positive, results-oriented “doer” with high quality output and ability to work under pressure/meet tight deadlines.
• Be a financially savvy and politically astute leader with the ability to set clear priorities, delegate, and guide investment in people and systems.
• Be trustworthy and always willing to both learn and teach, with a love for problem-solving and comfort working with ambiguity. A quick and adaptable learner. 
• Serve as a natural mentor and developer of people; personable with an innate desire to help others. This role requires a significant amount of organizational development.  
• Be committed to seeing your work as mission-based and an opportunity to make a powerful contribution to a larger effort.
• Be someone known to lead by example — comfortable helping out with day-­to-­day tasks as necessary, e.g. happy to get your hands dirty, clean up the mess, or set up chairs.
• Have an interest in a long-term role — we are a growing company, and we like to hire people who can grow with us over the years.


YOU HAVE
• At least 10-15 years of overall professional experience as a manager/leader of an organization
• Currently reside within Boston, Philadelphia, Providence, Miami or St. Louis.
• Be strongly connected into the startup and innovation ecosystems in at least one of those cities.
• Be able to travel 25% of the time which includes existing sites (Americas, Europe & Asia) and ad hoc expansion related requirements.
• Be comfortable gathering regularly with large groups including after hours.
• Management of an international multi-site organization preferred.
• Significant board development, fundraising, marketing/branding and fiscal management experience are a must.
• Keen analytic, organization and problem solving skills, which support and enable sound decision making.
• Excellent coalition-building skills, with an ability to communicate and work effectively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders; you are a persuasive negotiator able to achieve consensus amongst differing opinions.
• Outstanding presentation and communication skills, and the experience and proclivity to be an outgoing spokesperson, relationship builder, and fundraiser.
• Strong commitment to the professional development of staff; successful track record of recruiting and retaining a diverse team.

 
OUR OFFER
• Starting compensation is USD $200,000.00, plus benefits.
• Benefits include:
• 100% company-paid premium healthcare and dental benefits.
• 100% company-paid long- and short-term disability, and life insurance.
• 401k with percentage match after one year.
• Four weeks of vacation plus thirteen paid holidays.


JOB LOCATION
Our previous President was based in Australia, and found the time zone gaps vs. the location of the majority of our cafes was challenging.  She has encouraged us to locate our next President in the US.  With this recruitment effort, we seek a President who can be physically based at a site with a well-established, active Venture Café: Boston, Philadelphia, Phoenix, Providence, or St. Louis, with a preference for the Boston area.  We expect the President to be on-site (not remote) most of the time, as well as to travel regularly to each of the cafe locations.


ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB
In addition to the opportunity to help make the world a better place, we work to ensure each talented team member feels nurtured by many benefits, here are just a few:

• The opportunity to learn and develop skills within the epicenter of the innovation community within a growing global network.
• Opportunities for regular travel to Venture Café locations across the globe.
• You’ll join a team of driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to building our inspiring community. 
• Annual reviews with raises significantly above the national average every year for those on track with strong performance.
• Depending on your location, discounted services and memberships on tools to make your life happier/healthier such as gym memberships, tech and design support, hotel stays, and other fantastic options.


MORE ABOUT OUR VISION
What began in 2009 as a simple idea within the Cambridge Innovation Center (CIC) in Massachusetts to better connect people, ideas and resources has become a movement. If we’re going to solve humankind’s biggest and most pressing challenges, we need as many as possible involved. We believe that one day, across the world, ​we will all participate equally in the process of innovation​.


OUR CONNECTION TO CIC
CIC (Cambridge Innovation Center) is the founding organization and physical home of Venture Café in most of our cities. Since its founding, CIC has brought Venture Café to each new city it has expanded to, and has also supported expansion to cities where CIC does not yet have a presence. CIC is a global leader in building and operating innovation campuses that support the growth of entrepreneurs and startups. Founded in 1999 with a single location in Kendall Square, Cambridge (Massachusetts) the company now operates more than one million square feet of shared workspace, wet labs, and event space in the US, Europe, and Asia. Its campuses are frequently located adjacent to or on the land of leading universities such as MIT, Brown University, University of Pennsylvania, and Washington University of St. Louis.  CIC’s collaborative work environments support thousands of individuals in the for-profit and nonprofit sectors who are focused on innovating solutions to local and global problems.  Guided by the belief that stronger innovation ecosystems help to propel economic development and social impact, CIC has co-founded several mission-aligned organizations including the Venture Café Global Institute, LabCentral, MassRobotics and CIC Health.  CIC Health provided COVID-19 testing and vaccination services to millions of individuals, schools, and organizations. Learn more at cic.com.

job_title: CIC Health Director of Supply Chain and Logistics - Cambridge, MA
job_html:
Do you enjoy building world-class logistics and supply chain operations? CIC Health is looking for a full-time director to join our team. This is a great opportunity for someone with professional work experience, who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, and has an eye for details.


ABOUT CIC HEALTH
CIC Health – a subsidiary of CIC, is one of the fastest growing healthcare logistics and services companies in the country. We provide COVID-19 testing services to organizations such as schools, colleges, companies, elder care facilities, and others, as well as individual customers. In 2021 we were recognized by COLOR Magazine for our work on diversity, inclusion, and equity; Fast Company World Changing Ideas; MassTLC Tech Top 50, among other awards.

CIC Health is Cambridge (MA)-based, privately owned, public benefit corporation that is a subsidiary of CIC.  To-date, CIC Health has delivered COVID-19 testing and vaccination services to state and city governments, educational institutions, employers, and individuals across the United States.  Key milestones in our history include:

• Early 2020:  Cambridge Innovation Center, a global leader in building and operating innovation communities and laboratories, establishes its return to work safely playbook catching the eye of client, Nikhil Bhojwani.  Nikhil introduces CIC CEO, Tim Rowe to Dr. Atul Gawande, a nationally respected surgeon, writer, and public health leader.

• Summer 2020: Recognizing an urgent need to expand COVID-19 testing to slow the spread, Dr. Gawande and Tim Rowe, founded CIC Health, a logistics company that would go on to aggregate testing demand and marry it with untapped laboratory capacity across the United States quickly becoming one of the largest COVID-19 testing companies in New England and beyond.

• Winter 2020 to Summer 2021:  Inspired by the work of mass vaccination sites in the United Kingdom, CIC Health, in collaboration with the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, built and  operated the mass vaccination sites at Gillette Stadium, Fenway Park, Boston’s Hynes Convention Center, the Reggie Lewis Track and Athletic Center, as well as hundreds of community based locations.  CIC Health was particularly effective at serving urban, diverse, and economically disadvantaged communities; among the hardest hit by the pandemic.

• Fall 2021 to Spring 2022:  CIC Health launches a massive state-wide school-based testing campaign in Massachusetts, Vermont, New York City and Washington schools allowing for over 1 million school days to be saved.

OUR IMPACT TO DATE
• Performed over 6.5 million COVID-19 tests across 20 states.
• Administered over 1.2 million COVID-19 vaccinations.
• Delivered net promoter scores in the 80’s for our public testing operation, 50’s for our business-to-business enterprise, and 80’s for our vaccination sites.
• Been recognized as a 2021 Fast Company World Changing Ideas Award Winner, a  2020 & 2021 Massachusetts Tech Top 50 Honoree, and a recipient of the 2021 Color Magazine All-Inclusive Award in Leadership.
• Appeared in over 1,500 media pieces including printed and digital articles, TV and radio broadcasts and mentioned in over 325 TV segments, including:  CBS Sunday Morning, HBO Real Sports, The Today Show, Good Morning America, CNN, MSNBC, NPR, Telemundo, El Mundo Univision, ABC, NBC, PBS, Fox News, and CNBC.  

You can learn more about CIC Health offerings here. 


ABOUT CIC
CIC is a global leader in building and operating innovation communities. Founded in 1999 in Cambridge, MA, CIC is one of the first companies to offer flexible office space and co-working options, providing a platform for the world’s most impactful entrepreneurs to innovate better and faster.  We have locations in Boston, Cambridge, Philadelphia, Providence, Rotterdam, St. Louis, Warsaw, and Tokyo and are growing into other cities within the US and abroad. CIC has supported over 6,000 startups, growth companies, and branches of larger organizations, representing for-profit, mission-driven, and non-profit sectors across a wide array of industries.  CIC co-founded a number of mission-aligned organizations including Venture Café, CIC’s primary non-profit programming partner, and CIC Health, offering COVID-19 testing services to companies and the public.   

We invite you to explore all our openings and learn more about our teams here. 
 
 
YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
This position is responsible for the efficient operation of all Logistics, Distribution Centers and Supply Chain at CIC Health. The role is part of the leadership team at CICH Health and leads a small team to deliver the highest service levels across our network of couriers, distribution warehouses, manufacturers, and e-commerce partners. 
 
Creating and maintaining a culture of development and employee engagement, achieving operational metrics that contribute to the company’s overall goals and success, and engaging key business partners to ensure excellent customer service. 
 
Responsibilities:
• As Director, this position will be responsible for all CIC Health and client site-based supply chain functions.
• The team reporting to the Director will be composed of experts in functional supply chain management disciplines. 
• The Director must function as a mentor and facilitator of professional development opportunities for the team, so that the team stays optimally aligned with the changing healthcare landscape. 
• To be effective in this position, forming strong relationships with public and private partners, CIC and CIC Health leadership and staff will be necessary. 
• The director makes significant contributions to supporting cost containment for CIC Health, orchestrating supply management initiatives, and bringing innovation to CIC Health. This includes developing and participating in short-term tactics and long range plans that result in optimal use of supplies, services, inventory and performance within CIC Health and supply chain management operations. 
• The director will develop supply chain management strategies and in addressing daily supply chain operations, including process reengineering, utilizations management, supply chain systems coordination, customer service, receiving, inventory management, asset management, and distribution. 
• This position will be responsible for managing and adhering to capital and operating budgets.
• Proactively assess, continuously challenge and determine gaps and improvement opportunities in the current logistics setup (e.g. processes, technology/tools, physical infrastructure, vendor partnerships, etc.), and implement improvements.
• Use analytics to improve performance and find opportunities to minimize costs while improving service.
• Manage customer service related to supply and procurement and ensure effective management of the customer interface from a supply chain perspective, including communication on supply and sales orders, deliveries and issue resolution.
• Manage vendor and third party business partner relationships, ensure the quality of service, align objectives and results and evaluate the success of leveraging these services as part of the overall strategy.
• Implement a comprehensive ERP system for financial management, product planning, inventory management and procurement.
• Measure service performance by creating and tracking KPIs; provide periodic status reports to the executive leadership team on the overall health of logistics/inventory.
• Creative and resourceful in working with 3rd party vendors to design service networks that can efficiently distribute products to customers. 
• Manage to contract on behalf of CICH with couriers/logistics partners and negotiate costs/service level.
• Manage team of Logistics Associates and Logistics Procurement Manager, who will execute logistics and supply chain work.
• Effective people manager that can lead, hire and develop a high performing team
• Develop transformation plans to drive proposed changes in transportation, freight optimization, warehousing & distribution, and develop an implementation plan and estimated range and timing of benefits (OPEX / inventory/service delivery).
• Leads the End to End order fulfillment improvement and execution by taking the leadership role with the broader operations team to drive finished goods fulfillment initiatives.
• Seek out and evaluate cost-effective solutions to supply chain issues.
• Participate in Operations and Customer Success meetings for ongoing improvements, operational and strategic discussions. 
• Maintain a positive, can-do attitude and embrace a culture of customer success and operational excellence. 
• Support new business initiatives and growth opportunities with innovative solutions.
• Travel as needed (5-10% travel).

 
ABOUT YOU
Our ideal candidate is a service-minded individual who is reliable, clever, and able to work independently. As CIC Health develops over and against the shifting realities of the pandemic, you will demonstrate poise, flexibility, and acuity to make week-to-week adjustments.
 
More specifically, as our ideal candidate, you:
• Have strong analytical skills for planning and forecasting.
• Are excellent at relationship building.
• Have a thorough understanding of transportation projections and warehousing.
• Have strong communication and leadership skills.


YOU HAVE
• 10+ years of experience in logistics management (e.g. distribution center operations, process transformation, etc.).
• 5+ years of experience in healthcare systems, e-commerce, medical devices or life sciences industry, with a deep understanding of regulatory requirements for the industry (e.g. HIPAA, GDPR, ISO etc.).
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• System savvy and experience using relevant tools and technology such as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), database management software, Excel, inventory control software, supply chain software, etc.
• Availability and flexibility for weekend work on an as-needed basis is a plus.
• Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management , or 5-10 years of related field is required.
• MBA, MPH, Master’s in Engineering is preferred.
• Experience with enterprise resource management and demand planning software. 
• Experience with continuous quality and process improvement methodologies such as Lean or Six Sigma required.
• Experience working with or managing supply chain processes for e-commerce and /or healthcare preferred.
• Experience working in a fast-paced rapidly growing startup a plus.
• Experience working with cross-functional teams spread across time zones a plus.

OUR OFFER
• Starting compensation is commensurate with experience.
• 100% company paid premium healthcare and dental benefits.
• 100% company paid long and short-term disability, and life insurance.
• 401k (must be 21+).
• Three weeks of vacation (more with seniority) plus thirteen holidays from the start.   


ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB
In addition to helping our clients achieve great things, we work to ensure that our employees are healthy and supported. Some of the benefits of being here include:  

• Fun people in a dynamic space. We pride ourselves on finding driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to the team, as well as to our inspiring clientele. The number one reason CICers say they like working here is because of their colleagues!

job_html:
We are seeking a strategic, mission-driven and skilled professional to join the core team as Chief of Staff to the President. The Chief of Staff will report directly to the President and act as their right-hand partner to enable the success of the business and the culture of CIC Health as a  member of the leadership team.  The Chief of Staff will support (and in some cases own) key strategic responsibilities and initiatives in the organization and will also support the management process, culture and board engagement that enables our ability to achieve our mission and vision.

This is a rare opportunity to experience and support the buildout of the strategy, the business roadmap and culture of CIC Health with tremendous impact to public health and to be part of a passionate, skilled and committed team working together to realize our big and important vision of helping to build healthy communities and eradicate illness within the most vulnerable communities

ABOUT CIC HEALTH
CIC Health – a subsidiary of CIC, is one of the fastest growing healthcare logistics and services companies in the country. We provide COVID-19 testing services to organizations such as schools, colleges, companies, elder care facilities, and others, as well as individual customers. In 2021 we were recognized by COLOR Magazine for our work on diversity, inclusion, and equity; Fast Company World Changing Ideas; MassTLC Tech Top 50, among other awards.

CIC Health is Cambridge (MA)-based, privately owned, public benefit corporation that is a subsidiary of CIC.  To-date, CIC Health has delivered COVID-19 testing and vaccination services to state and city governments, educational institutions, employers, and individuals across the United States.  Key milestones in our history include:

• Early 2020: 
Cambridge Innovation Center, a global leader in building and operating innovation communities and laboratories, establishes its return to work safely playbook catching the eye of client, Nikhil Bhojwani.  Nikhil introduces CIC CEO, Tim Rowe to Dr. Atul Gawande, a nationally respected surgeon, writer, and public health leader.

• Summer 2020:
Recognizing an urgent need to expand COVID-19 testing to slow the spread, Dr. Gawande and Tim Rowe, founded CIC Health, a logistics company that would go on to aggregate testing demand and marry it with untapped laboratory capacity across the United States quickly becoming one of the largest COVID-19 testing companies in New England and beyond.

• Winter 2020 to Summer 2021: 
Inspired by the work of mass vaccination sites in the United Kingdom, CIC Health, in collaboration with the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, built and  operated the mass vaccination sites at Gillette Stadium, Fenway Park, Boston’s Hynes Convention Center, the Reggie Lewis Track and Athletic Center, as well as hundreds of community based locations.  CIC Health was particularly effective at serving urban, diverse, and economically disadvantaged communities; among the hardest hit by the pandemic.

• Fall 2021 to Spring 2022: 
CIC Health launches a massive state-wide school-based testing campaign in Massachusetts, Vermont, New York City and Washington schools allowing for over 1 million school days to be saved. 

OUR IMPACT TO DATE
• Performed over 6.5 million COVID-19 tests across 20 states.
• Administered over 1.2 million COVID-19 vaccinations.
•Delivered net promoter scores in the 80’s for our public testing operation, 50’s for our business-to-business enterprise, and 80’s for our vaccination sites.
• Been recognized as a 2021 Fast Company World Changing Ideas Award Winner, a  2020 & 2021 Massachusetts Tech Top 50 Honoree, and a recipient of the 2021 Color Magazine All-Inclusive Award in Leadership.
• Appeared in over 1,500 media pieces including printed and digital articles, TV and radio broadcasts and mentioned in over 325 TV segments, including:  CBS Sunday Morning, HBO Real Sports, The Today Show, Good Morning America, CNN, MSNBC, NPR, Telemundo, El Mundo Univision, ABC, NBC, PBS, Fox News, and CNBC.

You can learn more about CIC Health offerings here.   

ABOUT CIC
CIC is a global leader in building and operating innovation communities. Founded in 1999 in Cambridge, MA, CIC is one of the first companies to offer flexible office space and coworking options, providing a platform for the world’s most impactful entrepreneurs to innovate better and faster.  We have locations in Boston, Cambridge, Philadelphia, Providence, Rotterdam, St. Louis, Warsaw, and Tokyo and are growing into other cities within the US and abroad. CIC has supported over 6,000 startups, growth companies, and branches of larger organizations, representing for-profit, mission-driven, and non-profit sectors across a wide array of industries.  CIC co-founded a number of mission-aligned organizations including Venture Café, CIC’s primary non-profit programming partner, and CIC Health, offering COVID-19 testing services to companies and the public.     

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK 
In partnership with the President and senior leadership team:

• Plan end execute a robust management process (goals, KPIs, meetings, engagement) to support the growth and success of the business.
• In collaboration with the VP of People, develop the strategy and culture to make CIC Health a best-in-class and inclusive company to work for, measured by CIC Health’s ability to engage/recruit/retain top talent and by the successful execution of critical initiatives including on-boarding, development/performance management and DE&I.
• Implement robust processes and documentation to support a strong infrastructure and foundation to enable growth and execution that is effective and efficient.
• Support engagement of the board, in formal and informal ways, including meeting preparation and execution, 1:1 engagement of board members and engagement of the senior leadership team.
• Support high profile strategic relationships and partnerships that will enable the success of the company and team.
• Support the communication strategy and development of materials for key strategic topics and items, both written and verbal for internal and external use. This may include support of fundraising strategy and engagement.
• Serve as a proxy for the President and senior leadership team, internally and externally, acting on behalf of the senior leadership team from an engagement and communication perspective.


ABOUT YOU 
Our ideal candidate is a service-minded individual who is reliable, creative, and able to work independently. As CIC Health develops over and against the shifting realities of the pandemic (and beyond), you will demonstrate poise, flexibility, and acuity to make week-to-week adjustments. You have 7+ years of progressive leadership experience that includes strategic consulting or financial services AND, preferably, operational experience in a healthcare company (ideally a high-growth setting focused on execution). You also have:

• A succinct communication style about complex concepts both verbally and in writing, and use synthesized communications to drive results.
• Demonstrated EQ which is the springboard to building  trusting and strong collaborative relationships, internally and externally.
• Experience driving collaboration across senior leaders (including C-suite and BOD level) and communication across an organization to enable success, growth and achievement of mission and vision.
• Exceptional project management and program development skills with excellent detail orientation, communication, and organizational skills.
• The ability to  use insights from data and analysis  and translate the findings into action.
• Comfortable with ambiguity and bring a structured, proactive approach to get things done and execute (results-driven).
• Motivated with perseverance and confidence to solve complex problems, takes initiative, operates with integrity and autonomy, and succeeds in high pressure situations.

FROM A CULTURAL PERSPECTIVE YOU ARE
• Agile, yet thoughtful and can work effectively in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. 
• Constantly seeking ways to simplify and improve how things are done, bringing a positive attitude to challenges. 
• Accountable, holding yourself and others to a high standard and seek to support and develop others.
• Willing to roll up your sleeves to support the work required and collaborate effectively with people of all backgrounds. 
• Concise and articulate, drive towards clarity and deliver on your commitments. 
• Collaborative, assuming positive intentions.
• Passion for service to others which includes patients and providers who make healthcare possible. 

YOU HAVE
• Master’s degree in Public Health, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or similar field
• 5+ years in a business or executive management role
• Proven experience organizing and directing multiple teams and departments
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• A versatile workstyle, dedicated to efficient productivity
• Experience planning and leading strategic initiatives
• Experience with data analysis
• Experience with budget management
• A nimble business mind with a focus on developing creative solutions
• Strong project reporting skills, with a focus on interdepartmental communication

With the goal of prioritizing the health and well-being of our employees, a condition of employment for all new CIC Health employees is full COVID-19 vaccination by their start date. All candidates may request an exemption on the grounds of medical need or a sincerely held religious belief. Requests will be subject to review and approval by CIC Health and will only be granted if CIC Health is able to provide a reasonable accommodation. 

CIC is committed to building teams that reflect the fabric of the communities we support. We welcome all candidates regardless of race, color, ancestry, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status. If you require an accommodation please let us know. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. 

If you don't meet all the requirements or qualifications but bring some other unique skills and experience that would be valuable in this role, please apply and highlight those attributes for us in your cover letter.

OUR OFFER
• Starting compensation is commensurate with experience.
• 100% company paid premium healthcare and dental benefits.
• 100% company paid long and short-term disability, and life insurance.
• 401k (must be 21+).
• Four weeks of vacation plus thirteen holidays.

ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB
In addition to helping our clients achieve great things, we work to ensure that our employees are healthy and supported. Some of the benefits of being here include: 

• Fun people in a dynamic space. We pride ourselves on finding driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to the team, as well as to our inspiring clientele. The number one reason CICers say they like working here is because of their colleagues!
• Personal growth. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop skills within the epicenter of the innovation community at a growing company.
• Discounted services and memberships on resources to make your life happier/healthier such as gym memberships, tech and design support, hotel stays, and other fantastic options.

job_title: CIC Health Executive Aide to the President and the General Counsel
job_html:
CIC Health Executive Aide to the CIC Health President and General Counsel 
CIC Health seeks a driven, organized, energetic, and dedicated professional to serve as the Executive Aide to the President and General Counsel. Reporting directly to CIC Health’s President, you will principally support the President (60% of time) and General Counsel (40% of time), while occasionally supporting other members of the Senior Executive Team to execute shared priorities and provide office management support for the CIC Health team.  This is a unique opportunity for an exceptionally detail-oriented individual who thrives in a fast-paced work environment and is looking for boots-on-the-ground exposure to a dynamic, growing startup.  It also represents a unique opportunity to play a key role in helping our nation respond to the COVID-19 pandemic today and address a broader set of public health issues in the longer term. 

ABOUT RACHEL WILSON, PRESIDENT
Rachel currently serves as the President for CIC Health, a public benefit corporation that launched in 2020 to provide accessible, equitable, and fast COVID-19 testing and vaccination services to communities across the United States. Prior to CIC Health, Rachel served as the Chief Operating Officer at Atrius Health, Vice President of Ambulatory Operations and Program Development at New England Baptist Hospital, Director of Surgical Services Operations and Program Development at Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Orthopedic Service Line Administrator at Rush University Medical Center, Administrative Fellow at Northwestern Memorial Hospital, and Occupational Therapist at Montefiore Medical Center. She recently concluded a six year term on the Board of Directors of the Massachusetts Chapter of the American College of Healthcare Executives. In 2022, she was named an Aspen Institute Health Innovators Fellow and was named to The Boston Globe’s Tech Power Players 50 List.  In 2015, she was named to Boston Business Journal’s 40 Under 40 list and, in 2012, received the ACHE Regents Award for Early Career Healthcare Executive of the Year.   Rachel holds a Master of Healthcare Administration from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and a Bachelor of Science in Occupational Therapy from Elizabethtown College.

ABOUT MARIA BUCKLEY, GENERAL COUNSEL
Maria Buckley recently joined CIC Health as General Counsel. Previously, she was General Counsel, Chief Compliance Officer, Chief Privacy Officer, Chief Risk Officer and Clerk of the Joslin Diabetes Center. Maria came to Joslin from the Boston law firm Nutter McClennen and Fish LLP. She joined Nutter from Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, Inc., where she was senior counsel. Maria regularly speaks on various healthcare, research, commercialization and governance issues. She is an active member of the Health Law Section of the Boston Bar Association and was co-chair of the Massachusetts Biotechnology Council’s Law and Policy Committee. She has a leadership role in the Association of Corporate Counsel. Maria has been active in providing pro bono legal service and is a recipient of the Massachusetts Bar Association’s Pro Bono for Law Firms Award. Maria was named a Leader in the Law by Mass Lawyers Weekly and an ONC Top 50 Corporate Counsel. Maria received a J.D. from Suffolk University Law School, and a B.S. from Boston University.

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
You will join our CIC Health team and support its mission of helping public and private entities prevent serious pandemic-related illness and suffering by ensuring that the most effective public health interventions scale to communities everywhere.  Some work will be independent while other work will require collaboration with other members of the CIC Health and CIC staff.  Responsibilities will include:  

1. Scheduling and administrative support:
• Master of calendar tetris: heavy calendar management (utilizing Google Calendar) involving scheduling of the President and General Counsel’s meetings and appointments, maintaining an organized calendar while determining priorities, juggling professional commitments, and adapting to last-minute changes. In this capacity, you will demonstrate a sense of ownership for ensuring not just that everything is scheduled accurately, but achieving an optimal workflow experience (not only asking “can everyone attend the meeting,” but going beyond and ensuring a positive experience for all involved both in-person and remote). 
• Responding graciously and nimbly to schedule changes and conflicts, and dealing with any issues that arise, inside or outside of normal business hours.
• Acting as an internal and external gatekeeper, deciding the best use of the President and General Counsel’s time both in terms of meetings and in their project work. You would feel empowered to make decisions on behalf of the President  and General Counsel while understanding which decisions they need to be a part of. 
• Reserving conference rooms for large or company-wide calls such as our weekly all hands and leadership meetings.
• Reserving conference rooms (via Roomzilla) with the necessary hybrid technology for on site and/or hybrid meetings.
• Reconciling expenses and creating expense reports (both monthly expenses and travel expense reports). Serving as “internal “courier”: retrieving and delivering materials, as well as handling the ordering and distributing of food, office supplies, mail, and personal items.
• Coordinating business travel arrangements. This includes booking transportation (flights, trains, etc.), hotels, restaurant reservations and meetings while navigating various time zones.
• Handling confidential and sensitive information with the utmost discretion.
• Upon request, directly handling or delegating as much of the President and General Counsel’s email inboxes as possible.
• Reading, prioritizing, and organizing emails, responding on her behalf whenever necessary, minimizing the emails that they need to respond to directly and track follow-up. 

2. Project and committee work:
• Researching and creating presentation materials for speaking or meeting engagements. 
• Assisting with meeting agenda management and distribution, as well as taking minutes in meetings as needed. 
• Working on projects with other teams to assist when needed. Embodying the “happy to help” mentality.
• Participating in relevant project and committee work that will enhance your other responsibilities. (ex. being an active member on the CIC Health DEIB committee).  

3. Office management:
• Planning, coordinating and executing all CIC Health community events such as monthly Lunch & Learn sessions, social hours and larger company gatherings like the annual off-site company party. 
• Ordering office supplies:  Ensuring that the CIC Health office is fully equipped with needed materials. Tracking inventory and ordering more when needed/requested.
• Workstation setup: Purchasing, assembling and creating a “plug and play” desk setup for CIC Health employees. This includes ordering requested hardware (needs vary from team to team) and assisting with on-site support should they need it. Quarterly office deep cleanings: Working with the CIC community team quarterly to arrange for a professional office cleaning. 
• Package and mail management: Collecting and distributing mail and packages on a weekly basis.
• Acting as the main “point person” for all office related requests. This includes working closely with the CIC community team to ensure office functionality, maintain appearance and cleanliness, as well as technology requests (ex. updating the video conferencing systems or key card access to doors). 
• Maintaining and updating email distribution lists as employees onboard and offboard. This involves working closely with the talent team for hiring updates and the tech team for implementing the changes through Quickbase and/or google groups. 
• Welcoming new hires on site. This requires in-person attendance to greet them, ensure a smooth onboarding experience, provide a walk through of the building and be their point of contact for any questions they may have.  

ABOUT YOU
Our ideal candidate is a service-minded individual who is reliable, clever, and able to work independently. As CIC Health develops over and against the shifting realities of the pandemic, you will demonstrate poise, flexibility, and acuity to make week-to-week adjustments. You are a self-motivated and confident individual who can act as an intellectual support to President and General Counsel, with diplomatic grace. This role requires an excellent planner who possesses the ability to think ahead and who can identify snafus before they occur. This is not a 9-5 job. While you will be working during regular business hours, this role regularly requires project management skills and handling multiple issues as they surface in real time (mornings, evenings, weekends). There may be regular weekend work in order to keep on top of the workflow. 

More specifically, as our ideal candidate, you are:
• Able to “see around corners,” anticipating the President and General Counsel’s needs and heading off potential problems.
• Detail-oriented, capable of being the first point of contact for multiple conversations, and skilled at prioritizing a wide range of tasks.
• A careful listener and reader, with excellent professional communication skills (excellent grammar, gracious phone manner, etc).
• Able to absorb a high volume of information in a short amount of time, complete requests with limited information, and learn and adapt to the team’s preferences and needs.
• Curious, eager to learn, and a self-starter: this position carries a significant level of independent responsibility; while you will have the support of mentorship from the CIC EA team, you are eager and able to dive into projects with minimal oversight or direction while also balancing day-to-day administrative needs.
• Capable of building positive relationships with your team, clients, colleagues, and vendors, and are comfortable treating everyone in these groups as your equal.
• Someone who possesses the unruffled temperament and dedication of Pepper Potts, the cleverness of Q, the problem solving abilities of Carson, the insight and seeming omniscience of Mrs. Landingham, an accuracy on par with J.A.R.V.I.S., and 30 Rock Assistant Jonathan’s desire to go the extra mile, all combined with the passion and ambition of Andy Sachs.  
• Someone who is unrelentingly calm during chaos.  

YOU HAVE
• At least 3-5 years of professional experience (exceptional recent college graduates may also be considered if you have relevant experience).
• Proficiency with Outlook, Google suite (including Google Sheets, Google Slides, and Google Drive), and video conferencing applications.

A serial entrepreneur with a knack for research and finding innovative solutions.

ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB

job_title: Operations and Community Manager - Tokyo, JP
job_html:
Japanese version (English below)

CIC Tokyo では【Community Leader】を募集中です！
CICの日々のオペレーションを担当するチームのマネジメントを行う、経験豊富で自己管理をしながら自主的に動くことができる方を募集しています。
5年以上のマネジメントの実務経験をお持ちで、ペースの早い環境で働くのが好きで楽しめる方に最適なポジションです。

CIC is looking for a highly capable, self-directed and experienced individual to manage a team that will be responsible for day-to-day operations. This will be a great opportunity for someone with at least five years of hands-on, managerial experience who enjoys working in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
 

【CIC について】
CICは、イノベーションコミュニティの構築と運営におけるグローバルリーダーです。1999年、米国マサチューセッツ州ケンブリッジ市にて創設されたCICは、フレキシブルなオフィススペースとコワーキングスペースを提供し始めた最初の一社であり、同時に、世界で最もインパクトがある起業家たちがこの世界を早くより良き場所へと変革していくためのプラットフォームを提供し続けています。

アメリカではボストン、ケンブリッジ、マイアミ、フィラデルフィア、プロヴィデンス、よびセントルイス、欧州ではロッテルダムとワルシャワを拠点に事業を展開しており、これからさらに世界各地に進出の場を広げてまいります。CICはこれまでに6,000社以上に及ぶ企業や団体をサポートしてまいりました。スタートアップ企業、成長企業、また大企業の新規事業部隊など、CICが支援したクライアントの種別は、営利・非営利を問わず、また産業の垣根を超えて実に多岐に渡ります。

CICグループには、この使命を共有する姉妹組織がいくつかあります。ベンチャーカフェは、スタートアップ向けイベントプログラムを行う非営利組織です。また、CIC Healthは、民間企業や公共向けにCOVID-19の検査を提供しております。

【CIC Tokyo について】
CIC Tokyo は私たちの最新のセンターであり、アジアで最初の拠点です。2020年10月に東京虎ノ門にオープンしました。このセンターは、東京都港区虎ノ門にある虎ノ門ヒルズビジネスタワーの15階と16階の2フロアー合計約6,000平方メートルの広大なスペースを有し、250社以上の企業様にご入居いただけます。CIC Tokyoは、成長を目指す企業への支援にフォーカスし、また、ビジネスの成長とグローバル展開を加速させるサービスの提供、およびイノベーションが生まれるコミュニティの構築・運営に注力しております。
 
ABOUT CIC & CIC TOKYO
CIC is a global leader in building and operating innovation communities. Founded in 1999 in Cambridge, MA, CIC is one of the first companies to offer flexible office space and coworking options, providing a platform for the world’s most impactful entrepreneurs to innovate better and faster. We have locations in Boston, Cambridge, Philadelphia, Providence, Rotterdam, St. Louis, Warsaw, and Tokyo, and are growing into other cities.

CIC Tokyo is our newest site and the first located in Asia. Opened in October 2020 in one of the business districts of Minato-ku, CIC Tokyo is a one-of-a-kind innovation-oriented center in Japan with a total area of ​​about 6,000 square meters on the 15th and 16th floors of the Toranomon Hills Business Tower. We provide a vast workspace with the capacity to house more than 250 companies. CIC Tokyo is centered on companies that aim to grow, and communities and services that are looking to accelerate their business growth and global expansion. Because of its influence in startup and innovation scenery, CIC Tokyo has frequent visits of VIPs such as  Prime Minister Kishida, Governor Koike, and other business leaders in Japan. CIC Tokyo is now recognized as a prestigious center of new businesses and startups in Japan by business leaders in Japan.
 
Learn more about us here.
 

【YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK】
私たちは、チームメンバー全員が大小さまざまなタスクを引き受け、「できる」という姿勢を持つことで、お互いに協力し合い、助け合うことを期待しています。

本ポジションでは数名のメンバーで構成されているCommunity Teamに所属し、クライアントの日々のニーズに応えていただきます。
独立して行う仕事も、日本や世界各国のCICメンバーと協力して行う仕事もあります。

【具体的な業務内容】
・Community Teamのメンバーの管理、指導、トレーニング、タイムリーな業績評価を行い、メンバーの成長と専門的能力を身につけることのサポートをする
・チームの仕事量、リソース、士気、トレーニングの必要性を認識し、責任を持つ
・クライアントの入退去、オフィスのセットアップ、ITトラブルシューティングなどのサービスタスクをマスターし、クライアントのリクエストに応えられるようチームメンバーをトレーニングする
・新しいサービス、ベンダー、コミュニティの改善について調査し、実施する
・ビル管理担当者との良好な関係を維持する
・食品、家具などの在庫を確認し、発注・配送のスケジュールを立てる
・予算の調整をする・クライアントからの難しいリクエストに対応し、サービス品質と顧客満足度を維持する。
・コミュニティ構築のためのイベントを推進、開催し、クライアントの関心を引く
・他のチームと協力し、プロジェクトを完了させ、知識を共有する
 
YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
We look to every team member to collaborate and help each other by taking on any task big or small and having a "can do" attitude. You will join our Community Team which is composed of several employees to satisfy the day-to-day needs of our clients. Some work will be independent while at other times it will require collaboration with other members of the CIC staff (in Japan and globally).
 
• Manage, coach and train team members of our Community Team; conduct timely performance evaluations and support their growth and professional development.
• Be aware of and responsible for the team’s workload, resources, morale, and training needs; advocate for the team’s needs with upper management.
• Master service-oriented tasks such as client moves, office setup, and IT troubleshooting; train team members on completing client requests and delegate appropriately.
• Research and implement new services, vendors, and community improvements..
• Maintain a constructive landlord-tenant relationship with building management.
• Monitor inventory levels (food, furniture, etc) with an eye to ordering/delivery timetables.
• Coordinate budgets for daily operations as well as capital projects.
• Handle difficult client requests or encounters to maintain overall service quality and client satisfaction.
• Engage our clients through promoting and helping host community building events.
• Collaborate with other teams to complete projects and share knowledge.


【理想的な人物像】
☆サービス精神旺盛で、独立しており、問題解決力に長けている方
☆チームワークを重視する環境において、リーダーシップや管理の経験をお持ちの方

具体的に...
・オペレーションチームのマネジメント経験があること
・新しい取り組みをゼロからスタートさせることができる
・どんな環境でも、人当たりがよく、サポートすることもでき、冷静であること
・多くの仕事をこなし、細部にまで気を配ることができる
・机の組み立て、コピー機の修理など、クライアントのサポートを率先して行うことができる
・新しいスキルを積極的に学び、身につける
・状況や問題の解決策について、複数の視点から検討し、バランスをとる
・クライアントやスタッフに対して、創造的かつ効果的に、対面または書面でコミュニケーションをとることができる
・他人を助け、問題を解決することに関心を持って取り組める
・クライアント、同僚、ビル管理者、ベンダーと良好な関係を築き、維持することができるチームプレーヤーであること
・誰とでも気持ちよく仕事ができ、対等に接すことができる
 
ABOUT YOU
We like to employ service-minded people who are independent, clever problem-solvers. If you fit this profile, and have also developed the leadership and managerial skills important to a team-based environment, this might be the perfect opportunity. This is a job for a balanced, self-confident, down-to-earth individual. We are a team-based company, and your performance will be evaluated by your team members.
 
Our ideal candidate will:
• Have experience in managing an operations team.
• Be willing, able, and happy to start new initiatives from scratch.
• Remain personable, happy-to-help, and calm in any environment.
• Be equally comfortable with power drills, ethernet hubs, and proper punctuation.
• Be able to juggle many tasks and pay close attention to detail.
• Lead by example: be willing to get your hands dirty, build a desk, fix a copier, etc.
• Proactively seek out and master new skills.
• Explore and balance multiple perspectives on a situation or solutions to a problem.
• Communicate creatively and effectively to clients and staff, both in person and in writing.
• Possess a natural interest for helping others and solving problems.
• Be a true team player with the capacity to foster and maintain positive working relationships with clients, colleagues, building management, and vendors.
• Work comfortably with everyone, treating everyone as an equal.
 

 【応募条件】
・ネイティブレベルの日本語と、英語に堪能であること
・学士号または同等の経験
・スピード感のある環境でチームメンバーを管理した経験、および5～7年の職務経験
・これまでの経験から成長し、責任感を持っていること。また、成功を収めていること
・長期的に一緒に働いていただけること：CICは成長企業のため、長期的に私たちと共に成長できる人材を採用したいと考えています
・日本で働く資格をお持ちの方（現時点では、CICはビザスポンサーをしていません）

YOU HAVE
• A minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

The Director will work closely with leaders within Marketing, across senior leadership and with influencers across CIC. You will be responsible for ideating, creating, coordinating and leading communications initiatives and responses across the organization, in all the communities in which we operate, making measurable positive impact and building a best-in-class PR function, as well as leading a distributed group of global PR teams and resources.  

From communications strategy and crisis management to best practices created, shared, and reinforced across CIC, you have the opportunity to ensure CIC is poised to have broad recognition and is positioned well at all times to respond to and take advantage of ever-changing and ever-emerging opportunities and challenges in the public sphere.

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
You will report to the Chief Marketing and Experience Officer of CIC and will work closely with senior leadership and influencers including Marketing, Operations, Sales, People Success, and Finance. 

In this role you will work with a distributed team working on PR across our global sites. We seek a Director of Global PR who is curious, empathetic, creative, high-energy, goal focused, and comfortable building strong partnerships within a team, company, and communities. Someone with experience working with international media teams.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Global Public Relations Strategy: Own CIC communications plan, creating (together with the CMEO) and executing all initiatives and programs. Create and maintain the official CIC story and its connected CIC entities. Lead the communications launch strategy for new sites and product offerings. Lead financial strategy plan, forecasting, and quarterly business review for the PR function. Manage an annual budget, ensuring strategic allocation of funds and monthly tracking to meet agreed spending targets. Track and monitor objectives and key results against PR-specific and broader marketing team goals.
• Global Public Relations Execution: Execute the global expression of our story and brand across media with ongoing input from key countries/regions, key stakeholders, marketing team, and CIC leadership team. Demonstrate knowledge of the shared workspaces and shared lab spaces market trends and cultivate strong relationships with clients to continuously unearth new story opportunities. Ensure appropriate market analysis and competitive benchmarking input to all marketing programs and tactics. 
• Communications: Deliver clear and consistent external messaging pertaining to CIC’s offerings and impact. Work closely with the CMEO and any PR/Communications external agencies on all media related activities. Collaborate with internal teams to establish clear channels of communication. Ensure that all external CIC messaging, documents, and communication tactics are developed and implemented in alignment with the broader CIC ‘voice’ and business strategy. Closely collaborate with internal stakeholders to support internal communications when appropriate.
• Team Building: Manage, coach, and develop a great team around communications and PR functions and responsibilities, ensuring best-in-class understanding and efforts across a multi-person distributed team, and developing internal expertise within the team. As needs arise, work closely with the People Success team to identify, hire, engage, and develop your team to accomplish our goals.
• Leadership: Serve as a leader within our Marketing team, participating in leading, developing, and growing a team capable of high performance and delivery of high quality public relations, communication, and brand building and scaling; collaborate with/consult/support leadership across the organization; demonstrate leadership and business acumen; and enlist (as approved) and supervise external PR resources within budget.

It’s not expected that you’ll know everything that we do on day one. However, it is expected you'll be open, curious, and committed to your growth within CIC. What’s important is that you are a bright, curious person, interested in what we’re doing, willing to learn, and excited about developing others. 

More specifically, as our ideal candidate, you are:

• Poised. You are capable of communicating graciously and accurately with high level leaders, peers, and junior team members.

ABOUT CIC PHILADELPHIA
CIC Philadelphia is located within uCity Square at 3675 Market Street, alongside our local partner, the University City Science Center. At 3675 Market, we offer world-class offices and one of the largest shared wet lab facilities in the nation, while the Science Center supports its nationally recognized technology commercialization programs, as well as new programs focused on mentoring, funding, strategy development and resources to accelerate businesses from idea to IPO and beyond. 

Our shared wet labs provide science start-ups a way to get to work and leave the operational details with us. With ample space, a wide range of equipment, basic lab supplies and inventory, and a dedicated team, our clients can keep their focus on the critical parts of their business while we do the rest. We staff our shared wet lab space to support and consolidate logistics, to enforce environmental health and safety protocols, and to provide access, orientation and guidance on the proper handling of all our shared lab equipment. 

Together with the University City Science Center, we serve Philadelphia’s startups and serial entrepreneurs, aiming to catalyze and accelerate innovation and entrepreneurship in Greater Philadelphia. We are motivated by our amazing clients and aim to meet their needs every day.

As an Assistant Director, you also hold responsibility for our clients’ experience while partnering with our shared workspace teams. 

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Manage and mentor the lab team personnel. Carry out scheduled weekly check-ins with all direct reports. Plan and lead weekly Lab team meetings and daily standup meetings. Prioritize lab staff activities (routine tasks, special projects, and initiatives). Be aware of and responsible for the team’s workload, resources, morale, and training needs. Advocate for the team’s needs with upper management. Handle administrative tasks such as time sheets, reviews, etc.
• Work directly with the Director of Lab Operations to manage ongoing operations and improvement projects. Master onsite facilities offerings, including equipment. Ensure operations are running smoothl. Manage cross-team meetings and communication. Work closely with the Director of Lab Operations on goals/action items for cross-team syncs.
• Own Lab Team OKR management.
• Own SOPM creation and maintenance/implementation.
• Master service-oriented tasks such as lab move-ins/move-outs, lab setup, and equipment troubleshooting. Train team members on completing client requests and delegate appropriately.
• Build strong relationships with our amazing clients who are working on innovative and cutting-edge research projects. Handle difficult client requests or encounters to maintain overall service quality and client satisfaction. Engage our clients through promoting and hosting community building events. Participate and lead prospective client tours.
• Oversee inventory management, including equipment and consumables. Help develop and implement inventory system.
• Maintain vendor relationships. Research and implement new services, vendors, and community improvements.
• Serve as the primary Environmental Health and Safety point person (Biosafety Officer/Emergency lead). Ensure compliance with federal, state and local regulations, work closely with Lab Client lead on lab client training, and work closely with Equipment and Facilities lead to ensure facility compliance.
• Partner with the Sales/Events team on client/sponsor events & projects.  


ABOUT YOU
You learn fast, and you are willing and able to dive right in and figure it out when you aren’t familiar with a piece of equipment or scientific technique. You are self-motivated, value accountability and systems, and want to be a part of troubleshooting and solutions.

We like to employ service-minded people who are independent, clever problem-solvers. If you fit this profile, and have also developed the leadership and supervisory skills important to a team-based environment, this might be the perfect opportunity. This will be a job for a balanced, self-confident, down-to-earth individual. We are a team-based company, and your performance will be evaluated by your team members.

Our ideal candidate will:
• Have the ability to mentor and coach junior Lab team members by leading by example and modeling respectful, professional behavior.
• Utilize critical thinking to troubleshoot and provide solutions to problems as they arise. Provide potential solutions, and act independently to apply solutions.
• Be willing, able, and happy to help; service-minded on a path of continuous learning.
• Have experience in operations oversight in a fast-paced environment.
• Remain personable and calm in any environment.
• Be reliable, clever, and able to work independently to connect the dots.
• Be able to juggle many tasks and pay close attention to detail.
• Be driven to keep order around you.
• Look around corners and anticipate potential hold-ups.
• Communicate creatively and effectively with your team and clients, in person and in writing.
• Proactively seek out and master new skills.
• Explore and balance multiple perspectives on a situation or solutions to a problem.
• Be excited and eager to merge work that is lab/tech focused with relationship building and client-facing work.
• Possess a natural interest for helping others and solving problems.
• Value equity and treat all staff equitably.


YOU HAVE
• A college degree in laboratory science, chemistry, biology or another life science, or equivalent work experience; advanced degree preferred.
• At least 5 years of hands-on lab experience.
• At least 3 years of supervisory experience.
• The ability to lift over 40 pounds and work on your feet for several hours at a time.
• Experience working with biohazardous material and/or working in a Biosafety Level 2 lab are a big plus.
• Certifications in EHS, management/supervision a plus.

ABOUT CIC & CIC TOKYO
CIC is a global leader in building and operating innovation communities. Founded in 1999 in Cambridge, MA, CIC is one of the first companies to offer flexible office space and coworking options, providing a platform for the world’s most impactful entrepreneurs to innovate better and faster. CIC Tokyo is our newest site and the first located in Asia. Opened in October 2020 in one of the business districts of Minato-ku, CIC Tokyo is a one-of-a-kind innovation-oriented center in Japan with a total area of ​​about 6,000 square meters on the 15th and 16th floors of the Toranomon Hills Business Tower. We provide a vast workspace with the capacity to house more than 250 companies. CIC Tokyo is centered on companies that aim to grow, and communities and services that are looking to accelerate their business growth and global expansion. Because of its influence in startup and innovation scenery, CIC Tokyo has frequent visits of VIPs such as  Prime Minister Kishida, Governor Koike, and other business leaders in Japan. CIC Tokyo is now recognized as a prestigious center of new businesses and startups in Japan by business leaders in Japan.
 
Learn more about us here.
 
 
YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
As an Accountant you will take part in financial processes and conduct daily accounting operations. You will engage in the preparation of reliable and adequate financial and operational reports. You will be encouraged to give solicited and unsolicited advice on financial issues and be expected to be determined to make the financial control of the month-end closing a success.
You will be involved in projects from a financial point of view and assist with financial issues and preparing the annual accounts. You will also maintain good internal and external contacts.
 
In addition to the above you will:
• Supporting and Assisting the Financial Controller. 
• Ensuring  accuracy, timeliness and completeness of the financial records of CIC Tokyo.
• Preparing and closing the monthly reports.
• Preparing the quarterly forecast and budget.
• Monitoring budgets, allocation and use of financial resources and results.
• Proactively contribute to the optimization of various processes in a highly dynamic and rapidly changing environment.
• Handling the month-end close process, including preparation of journal entries, balance sheet reconciliations, and various analytics relating to assigned properties.

• Assisting banking operations and cash flow management.
• Administering the timesheet system and providing a payroll company with monthly payroll data. 
• Assisting with various corporate administrative tasks.
• Partnering with the general manager and other operational staff to provide insightful and informative financial information and analysis used to make operational decisions.
• Other projects, as appropriate.


ABOUT YOU
You are an articulate, ethical individual who thinks critically, understands the nuances of effective communication, and is interested in a career contributing to the Finance Team function for a growing global organization.

The ideal candidate will possess the following characteristics:
• Capable of leading initiatives with autonomy and collaborating with colleagues to gain input and buy-in.
• Self-motivated with the desire to learn all aspects of our business from the ground.
• Possesses a high degree of integrity and discretion: this role will have access to sensitive, private data, such as compensation information, performance review feedback, and other personal information.
• Takes ownership of tasks and follows them through to completion.

• Exceptionally organized, skilled at solving process challenges and guiding teammates through change.
• Curious and excited to learn about the world of recruiting at CIC, and comfortable asking for help when faced with uncertain situations.
• Able to participate in a shared learning environment, and take lead on areas where you have experience and being open to learning from others.
• Passionate about data, metrics and well-informed decision making in order to critically think about one's actions.


YOU HAVE
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance and Accounting, Finance or Accounting.
• At least 5 years of professional experience in accounting, controlling or financial management.
• Native Japanese and fluent in business English level of speaking, writing and reading. Additional language fluency is a plus.

• Analytical mind and exceptional attention to details.
