This role will lead our pipeline building and transaction work in a number of cities in Asia, driving the development process from initial site selection through deal execution with ongoing coordination with our in-house design and construction team. 


YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
As an outspoken expert in and advocate for our business, you identify and present the strongest and best opportunities to develop new locations for CIC. Collaborating across internal teams, you are highly visible to external audiences including stakeholders and potential partners. You use your knowledge and your research to answer questions before others ask, identify the most exciting and sound opportunities for us to explore, and ensure that our business leaders and development partners are set up for success. As the owner of and catalyst for a portfolio of our expansion projects, you are responsible for ensuring timely and successful completion of the activities that power our new initiatives. 

Potential responsibilities will include:
• Build a pipeline of high quality projects in a portfolio of markets that you own, drawing upon and creatively employing a broad range of deal and financing structures as well as high level relationships you build with landlords, brokers and partner organizations.
• Lead the site selection process, build an investment case for the projects you’ve identified, and secure internal approval from the investment committee while working in collaboration with multiple internal and external stakeholders and participants. This process includes but is not limited to planning for design and construction as well as successfully navigating through and owning the approval, negotiation, agreement, and project kick-off stages for new projects.
• Compellingly present the CIC value proposition, how our business works, and the impact of our innovation communities for building owners and other prospective partners. 
• Draft and review early stage agreements and contracts with prospective partners.
• Coordinate, organize, liaise, and communicate across internal and external teams and individuals to successfully stand up and deliver work projects and agreements, ensuring everyone is successfully completing their pieces of the shared work.
• Prepare sound qualitative models and analyses, and presentations that demonstrate with evidence and argument the strategic recommendations for new products and new initiatives.
• Identify and find solutions for any insufficient information, speed bumps, and roadblocks from the earliest moments in a project, and keep work on track, communicating and executing with our existing and future partners, stakeholders, and collaborators.
• Contribute to a culture of learning and improvement by seizing opportunities to train, coach, and share knowledge with the rest of the team. 


ABOUT YOU
You are a strong relationship builder and deal maker who is analytically oriented, data driven, and able to work independently. Ideally, you possess the following characteristics:

• A strong work ethic and ability to make your own deadlines and meet them, and exceed expectations.
• A proactive approach.
• Excellent judgment that positively shapes business decisions and outcomes.
• An abiding drive to continuously learn and improve.
• A sense of urgency and a sense of humor.
• Transaction experience with a variety of commercial real estate, urban planning, and development projects and deal structures. This could include but is not limited to: acquisitions, joint ventures, management contracts, and leasing. 
• Exceptional written/verbal communication and organizational skills. Hands on doer with the ability to own and drive forward myriad tasks and get the details right.
• Understanding of financial drivers and structures for real estate transactions, as well as (with training) the core drivers of our business. Ability to serve as a thought partner with corporate finance to develop deal models, financing structures, as well as modeling new deal structures or products. 
• The ability to drive transactions as well as the experience, confidence, and communication skills to work seamlessly with executive leadership. 
• Self-motivated with ability to anticipate problems and needs.
• Team player who is personable, happy to help others, and naturally drawn to a very busy, ever-evolving environment.
• Independent, self starter, trustworthy, and quick to identify their own areas for development or improvement.
• A commitment to “mission” based work. See your work as an opportunity to make a powerful contribution to a larger effort.


YOU HAVE
• Bachelor’s degree required.
• Minimum of 6-10 years of professional experience, including experience in commercial real estate, the shared space industry, hospitality, and business development.
• A network of real estate contacts in CIC target markets.
• Willingness to travel up to 20% of time.
• Comfort with excel and pivot tables, and ideally some familiarity with budgets.
• A natural passion for startups, innovation, and entrepreneurship.
• Native Japanese and fluent in business English level of speaking, writing and reading. Fluency in Chinese and Korean is a plus.
• Analytical mind and exceptional attention to details.
• An interest in a long-term role — we are a growing company, and we like to hire people who can grow with us over the years.


OUR OFFER
• Starting compensation is commensurate with experience.
• Commuting / Transportation Allowance.
• Laptop and mobile phone as your working tools.
• Regular evaluation of your work, and salary raises based on performance.
• Hybrid working style and flex time available.
• Access to Venture Cafe Tokyo, a weekly Thursday gathering involving high-impact programming designed to engage the broader entrepreneurial community.


ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB
In addition to helping our clients achieve great things, we work to ensure that our employees are healthy and supported. Some of the benefits of being here include:
• Fun people in a dynamic space. We pride ourselves on finding driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to the team, as well as to our inspiring clientele. The number one reason CICers say they like working here is because of their colleagues!
• Personal growth. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop skills within the epicenter of the innovation community at a growing company.

job_title: Executive Aide to the Chief Marketing & Experience Officer - Cambridge, MA
job_html:
CIC is looking for a driven, organized, creative, curious, and dedicated person to be the Executive Aide to the Chief Marketing & Experience Officer (CMEO), Rodrigo Martinez. This role would support the CMEO, his team, and work alongside the rest of the Executive and Administrative support team at CIC. This is a fantastic opportunity for an exceptionally detail-oriented individual who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, creative, community-oriented work environment.   


ABOUT RODRIGO MARTINEZ
Rodrigo is Chief Marketing & Experience Officer at CIC, the premier workspace for startups and small companies. Previously he worked at IDEO and BCG. He is a creative business leader and entrepreneur with 20+ years of diverse international experience. He has appeared in HBO, CBS, Bloomberg, TED, NPR, HBR among others and has won numerous awards from FastCo, MIT Tech Review, CNBC, among others.
 

ABOUT CIC
CIC is an award-winning, global leader in building and operating innovation communities. Founded in 1999 in Cambridge, MA. CIC is one of the first companies to offer flexible office space and coworking options, providing a platform for the world’s most impactful entrepreneurs to innovate better and faster. 

We have locations in Boston, Cambridge, Philadelphia, Providence, Rotterdam, St. Louis, Warsaw, and Tokyo and are growing into other cities, within the US and abroad. CIC has supported over 8,000 startups, growth companies, and branches of larger organizations, representing for-profit, mission-driven, and non-profit sectors across a wide array of industries.  

CIC co-founded a number of mission-aligned organizations including Venture Café, CIC’s primary non-profit programming partner, and CIC Health, offering COVID-19 testing services to companies and the public. 

We invite you to explore all our openings and learn more about our teams here.  


YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
We are looking for someone with a unique combination of skills and style to amplify our executives’ abilities to accomplish their day-to-day work. With full access to Rodrigo’s email, this position will be responsible for managing, reviewing, and responding to inbound communications as needed. The role will also manage a variety of calendaring and project responsibilities for Rodrigo and, on occasion, his team (Marketing & Experience). 

Responsibilities will include:  
• Calendar management: Scheduling meetings and conference calls, determining priorities, and enjoying the giant game of Tetris that is high-level scheduling. This role involves heavy calendar management, maintaining an organized calendar while determining priorities, working with the schedules of other team members, juggling professional commitments, and adapting to last-minute changes. In addition to scheduling conference calls and meetings, making sure Rodrigo is prepared for all of them with any auxiliary materials, presentations, or research, and occasionally attending meetings to take minutes and track follow-ups.
• Project work: Handling high-level projects for Rodrigo and the team(s) that Rodrigo works with directly. This work varies but may include doing research, running reports, reconciling invoices, and possible design and experience-related projects.
• Location management: Planning travel for Rodrigo and occasional trips that involve multiple members of his teams, including booking hotels, flights, and ground transportation. Keeping track of Rodrigo’s whereabouts and carefully maintaining and communicating with him regarding his schedules so that Rodrigo can get to meetings on time and stay on track.
• Expense management: Reconciling expenses and creating expense reports (both monthly expenses and travel expense reports) through Tallie Expense software.
• Inbox management: Monitoring and managing Rodrigo’s inbox, sorting priority communication and graciously communicating on his behalf at times. Keeping track of projects within the inbox to know who is working on what projects and where there might be additional support needed. 
• Creative problem solving: Thinking proactively to better plan and forecast Rodrigo’s time — provide agendas and updates as often as possible in order to keep him on top of his priorities and maintain a master list of current projects to ensure that nothing falls through the cracks.
• On-the-ground support: Being on call during the day to receive/greet/orient Rodrigo’s visitors and guests and plan for said meetings. Periodically acting as an internal “courier” to retrieve and deliver materials, office supplies, mail, and occasionally, personal items.
• Team support: Serving as support for the Marketing team, adapting to organizational needs, and jumping in to support other team members as needed.  


ABOUT YOU
You are a self-motivated and confident individual who can act as an intellectual support to two executives, with diplomatic ease. You are curious and creative (a plus). This role requires an excellent planner who possesses the ability to think ahead and who can identify snafus before they occur, as well as someone who is comfortable with and capable of wisely dividing their time between priorities. 

More specifically, as our ideal candidate, you are:
• Comfortable with supporting an executive and knowing how to identify and communicate when competing priorities arise, and when to manage up. 
• Meticulously attentive to details and able to “see around corners,” using excellent judgment to anticipate executives’ needs and head off potential problems.
• Highly ethical with a proven track record of handling sensitive information and maintaining complete confidentiality with the highest levels of professionalism.
• Committed to work that is mission based; this work is an opportunity to make a powerful contribution to a larger effort.
• Comfortable gatekeeping and saying no to a wide variety of people, while also maintaining a friendly and empathetic outward demeanor. You are unrelentingly calm during chaos.
• Organized while managing a large amount of (often very confidential) information and contacts in order to help prioritize Rodrigo’s time.
• Easily adaptable. You are able to manage multiple conflicting priorities and changing working conditions without loss of composure.
• A deeply attentive listener and reader who can absorb a lot in a short amount of time. You are a strong professional communicator, from your gracious phone manners to your meticulous attention to grammar in writing.
• A strong strategic thinker. You are eager to learn the nuances in your executive’s preferences – in order to make high level decisions – as well as the preferences of their contacts – in order to develop and maintain relationships with networks on their behalf.
• Able to work with limited direction, owning and managing tasks independently, but unafraid to ask questions as necessary.
• Personable, happy to help others, and naturally drawn to a very busy, ever-evolving environment.
• Curious and intuitive. You have an interest in remaining current on your surroundings so you can add deeper value and context to your work
• Both a “doer” and a “thinker.” You are someone who rolls up their sleeves and jumps right in no matter what, but always in a thoughtful manner.
• Creative with an eye for design and aesthetics is a plus.  


YOU HAVE
• At least 3 years of administrative experience (exceptional recent college graduates may also be considered if they have relevant experience).
• Fluency in Google suite and video conferencing applications.
• Knowledge of Adobe suite is a plus.
• Schedule flexibility. While you will be working during regular business hours, this role regularly requires project management skills and handling multiple issues as they surface in real time (mornings, evenings, and occasionally weekends during busy seasons or when Rodrigo travels).
• The ability to work in Kendall Square in Cambridge at least 3x a week (Tu-Thurs). 
• An interest or experience in marketing, design, hospitality, and/or real estate is a plus.
• An interest in a long-term role. We are a growing company, and we like to hire people who can grow with us over the years. If you don't meet all the qualifications and preferences but bring some other unique skills and experience that would be valuable in this role, please apply and highlight those attributes for us in your cover letter.  


OUR OFFER
• Starting compensation is $75,934.
• 100% company-paid premium healthcare and dental benefits.
• 100% company-paid long- and short-term disability, and life insurance.
• 401k (must be 21+).
• Three weeks of vacation (more with seniority) plus thirteen holidays from the start.      


ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB
In addition to helping our clients achieve great things, we work to ensure that our employees are healthy and supported. 

Some of the benefits of being here include:
• Fun people in a dynamic space. We pride ourselves on finding driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to the team, as well as to our inspiring clientele. The number one reason CICers say they like working here is because of their colleagues!
• Personal growth. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop skills within the epicenter of the innovation community at a growing company.
• Access to a nursing room, secure bicycle parking, a maker space, a gym, shower rooms with towels, and discounted services and memberships on tools to make your life happier/healthier such as gym memberships, tech and design support, hotel stays, and other fantastic options.
• Central location. CIC Cambridge is a stone’s throw from the Kendall Square MBTA Red Line stop. CIC Boston is centrally located in downtown Boston and is within walking distance to the Blue, Green, Orange, and Red line.

We’re looking for someone with a schedule open in the afternoon and evening to assist with our events happening later in the day.  


YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK
This person will join our Events teams to maintain and troubleshoot AV equipment in District Hall and CIC event spaces, train CIC Providence staff and clients to use the equipment, and identify and implement technical improvements to keep CIC Providence event spaces competitive.

 Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
• Maintenance of CIC’s professional-grade audio and visual equipment, including audio interfaces, sound boards, amplifiers, speakers, wireless microphone systems, projectors, portable displays, multimedia devices, adapters, and cabling. 
• Maintain and organize equipment inventories and comprehensive training materials for audio and visual equipment at CIC Providence. 
• Troubleshoot A/V issues encountered by CIC clients and staff while utilizing our spaces and offerings. In the moment (preferably in-person) support when clients encounter equipment failure in a conference room or event space. 
• Serve as the main point of contact for evening Events team staffers in need of troubleshooting support. Coordinate and conduct A/V training events for new and existing staff members of various comfort/experience levels. Create and update training materials.
• Lead quarterly meetings with Event team members to identify pain points, training opportunities, or persistent system challenges associated with technical equipment and needs within our spaces.
• May spec and install professional-grade and easy-to-use AV equipment for use in CIC public spaces (event spaces, conference rooms, kitchens, etc). Identify changing needs of clients, event hosts, and CIC staff.
• Stay up-to-date on new technology that could be implemented throughout CIC to keep the company ahead of the curve and competitive in a growing market. This may involve self-guided research, attending industry trade shows, developing relationships with vendors/technicians, and attending professional events in the greater Providence/Boston area. 
• Assist with physical setup of event spaces (eg. table and chair arrangement). Assist with advanced A/V setup for specific events (eg. multi-mic panels, MS Teams / Google Hangout / Zoom meetings, audio and video recording/streaming).
• Support CIC clients with AV walkthroughs, intensive AV support during events upon request, developing training materials and signage for clients, and building strong professional relationships with clients and event hosts in the community.
• General upkeep of CIC’s event spaces, including regular setup, storage, and organizing of standard offerings (seating, tables, plateware, whiteboards, etc). 
• Depending on availability and need, may support Global Events, CIC Tech, Construction, or Operations teams in specific time-bound projects, such as implementing new hybrid event setups.  


ABOUT YOU
Overall, we like to employ service-minded people who are reliable, clever, and able to work independently. It’s not expected that you’ll know everything that we do on day one. What’s important is that you are a bright person, interested in what we’re doing, and willing to learn.  

More specifically, we are looking for someone who possesses the following characteristics:
• Independent, trustworthy, and willing to learn.
• Experience and comfort with AV equipment (such as audio interfaces, audio & visual cabling, hybrid event technology) and troubleshooting.
• Detail-oriented and organized with solid time management skills.
• Able to keep calm in stressful situations.
• Personable and naturally enjoys helping others.
• Comfortable acting as an events “liaison,” welcoming new guests to the community.
• Confidence in understanding nuances of written and verbal communication.
• Enjoys working on their feet and being on the move. If you’re the type of person who finds yourself straightening chairs wherever you go, this may be the role for you!
• Brings a fresh perspective and new ideas to everything.  


YOU HAVE
• At least 1 year of professional experience in a corporate environment.
• Experience working with corporate event hosts and organizers.
• A strong desire to make the use of technology and AV equipment a straightforward and pleasant experience.
• May have previous experience in related roles for music or entertainment venues, running AV for local meetups or civic groups, or assisting with AV on set for video or other production environments.
• The ability to lift and move up to 35 pounds and also push or pull heavy objects. Please note that this job requires walking, standing, sitting, bending, stooping, and reaching.
• Availability to work between 12:00 pm and 8:00 pm, Monday through Friday, for 20-25 hours per week. May require assisting with events during other times or days; we always plan at least two weeks in advance. Flexibility welcome!
• The ability to work autonomously. You may be staffing events when most other CIC staff members are assisting with other events or have gone home, and a supervisor will not be onsite after 5pm. We are looking for someone who thinks critically and is able to respond thoughtfully in the moment.

If you don't meet all the requirements or qualifications but bring some other unique skills and experience that would be valuable in this role, please apply and highlight those attributes for us in your cover letter.  


OUR OFFER
• Starting compensation is $25/hour.
• 401k matching after the first year of employment (must be 21+).
• 13 paid holidays per year.  


ATTRACTIONS OF THE JOB
In addition to helping our clients achieve great things, we work to ensure that our employees are healthy and supported. 

Some of the benefits of being here include:
• Fun people in a dynamic space. We pride ourselves on finding driven and bright collaborators who are eager to lend their own unique skills to the team, as well as to our inspiring clientele. The number one reason CICers say they like working here is because of their colleagues!
• Personal growth. This is a great opportunity to learn and develop skills within the epicenter of the innovation community at a growing company.

Located in a brand new building in the historic Jewelry District, now Providence’s Innovation and Design District, the 191k square foot space is anchored by CIC and shared by Brown's School of Professional Studies and the city's first civic gathering space, known as District Hall Providence. job_title: Senior IT Help Desk Specialist - Warsaw, PL
job_html:
Do you enjoy solving problems? Are you passionate about IT? Do you enjoy relationship building and providing a great client experience?

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY WORK

You will be responsible for introducing existing processes and developing new ones that will improve the work we do and the support we provide.  This role will also require occasional international travel to other CIC offices.

YOU HAVE

job_html:

HBX focuses on delivering the latest, trend-setting fashion, accessories, shoes, home and lifestyle goods to its customers, curating a truly global and exciting assortment at the leading edge of culture. Responsibilities:

    • Analyze the online customer journey (UI/UX) and competitive online e-commerce market landscape to drive improved customer experience and user growth across the web and app platforms.
    • Gather user requirements across the relevant stakeholders and set design requirements based on information gathered across internal teams and user research.
    • Ensure branding and brand elements are conveyed consistently, effectively and cohesively across products and UI/UX.
    • Perform regular market research and identify new product improvement opportunities.

    • Develop innovative solutions to drive deeper customer engagement and conversion on platforms across regions, product areas and functions.

    • Degree holder in Product Design, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or quantitative disciplines.
    • 2+ years of experience working with product teams and/or web analytics; experience with digital marketing campaigns and e-commerce is highly preferred. 
    • Proven experience in all phases of the design process including user research, copywriting, wireframing, prototyping, visual design, interaction design, and testing.

    • Experience developing and launching products.

job_html:
We are looking for a passionate Experiential Producer to join our team in New York City. The role of the Experiential Producer will be to plan for, manage and oversee US and global experiential based campaigns across HYPEBEAST + HYPEBAE (branded content) and HYPEMAKER (creative agency). As an experiential producer, you will work across both HYPEBEAST and HYPEBAE projects bringing IRL concepts to life including but not limited to - pop ups, parties, retail experiences, panel discussions, community workshops and art installations. You will need a great network of vendors - creative partners, production companies, fabrication teams, etc. in order to pull together the best qualified teams for the project at hand. You will need to have a deep understanding of budgeting experiential events and scoping out potential concepts for the team - advising where adjustments should be made for the strongest outcome of the experience.

The Experiential Producer role will need to have a hardworking and collaborative attitude as the role will include cross-team communication internally and externally. You will be working closely with internal teams, external vendors and clients.  The Experiential Producer will report to the Executive Producer and work on the US creative production team to successfully execute campaigns. The Experiential Producer will be responsible for maintaining a smooth and efficient process across all projects and upholding the HYPEBEAST and HYPEBAE brand across all creative.

What we’d like to see:

    • Event and experiential production experience with ambitious technical and hardware integrations
    • Proven track record for managing large campaigns from creative concepting to design drawing to fabrication 
    • Ability to lead teams of varying levels of production experience and knowledge from the inception of an idea to a detailed scope (agency fees), clearly and accurately defining project guidelines and risks
    • Excellent negotiation experience (especially contract negotiations) with both clients and partners

Duties will include, but are not limited to:

    • Maintain an organized system for administrative duties -  bids, invoicing, outreach, equipment, and third party vendor management
    • Create, manage and oversee timelines, budgets, production plans and talent/vendor contracts
    • Secure, vet, negotiate, manage talent, crew, locations, etc.
    • Work closely with the creative team to uphold the standards of the HYPEBEAST brand
    • Continually improve efficiency and enforce our production process
    • Ensure all productions are wrapped in a timely manner and within budget
    • Track project timelines and deadlines - ensuring creative team, account teams, clients and vendors are kept informed and workload is maintained at a manageable level 
    • Maintain a strong network of vendors to execute projects
    • Create innovative and smooth IRL experiences that build the HYPEBEAST community in a meaningful way

The ideal candidate is:

    • Informed - Up to date on fashion, music and the arts, as well as knowledgeable about HYPEBEAST culture
    • Creative - You are constantly assessing the needs of branded IRL experiences and can develop new and innovative ideas with the team to elevate all projects
    • Very Well Organized - Punctual and methodical, with a stellar memory, and with airtight organizational skills. You are the person the team will count on to be on top of everything. You will be expected to keep track of many projects at once without letting details slide through the cracks
    • Flexible - Humble and willing to tackle sometimes mundane but essential tasks with overall willingness to learn
    • Resourceful - The ability to secure talent, locations, and resources quickly. Can pivot and adapt to unforeseen circumstances that often arise. The expertise to foresee when outside resources are necessary
    • Autonomous - The ability to take direction, but needs a little management and oversight to get the job done
    • Goal-focused - The drive to complete tasks smoothly and efficiently
    • Positive/Charismatic - A people-person who knows how to get the best out of their team, while maintaining a great relationship with trusted vendors, creatives, and freelancers. Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions.  

TWO-YEAR FELLOWSHIP: ASSOCIATE STAFF ATTORNEY AT PUBLIC POLICY LITIGATION & LAW DEPARTMENT OF PLANNED PARENTHOOD FEDERATION OF AMERICA 

The Public Policy Litigation & Law (PPL&L) Department of Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) seeks applicants for the two-year fellowship position of Associate Staff Attorney. This position can be located either in New York City or Washington, DC.

ORGANIZATION DESCRIPTION
Planned Parenthood is one of the nation’s leading health care providers, educators and advocates, serving women, trans and nonbinary patients, men, teens and families. Our 49 locally governed affiliates operate more than 600 health centers, serving the diverse needs of each community. For over 100 years, we’ve worked tirelessly to improve and promote the health and safety of the communities and patients we serve, prevent unintended pregnancies, and guarantee that safe and legal abortion services are available to all patients who need them.

PPL&L represents PPFA and Planned Parenthood affiliates in policy matters that affect the mission of the organization. We conduct litigation in state and federal courts across the country, and we provide legal advice to PPFA and Planned Parenthood affiliates about legal issues such as pending legislation, regulatory matters, and activities of those opposed to Planned Parenthood that interfere with our ability to provide comprehensive reproductive health care.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
The Associate Staff Attorney is a junior position with PPL&L. The primary responsibilities revolve around providing litigation support to the other attorneys within PPL&L, including conducting legal research, drafting memoranda and other legal documents, working with expert witnesses, and communicating with clients. The Associate Staff Attorney will also be engaged in work related to pending legislation and regulatory matters. The PPL&L staff is split between New York City and Washington, DC. Regardless of where the Associate Staff Attorney locates, they would work extensively with the entire PPL&L team, as well as with other staff at PPFA.

QUALIFICATIONS 
§ Law degree.
§ Outstanding credentials with one to three years of legal experience, such as a clerkship or as a litigation associate in a law firm.
§ Strong research and writing skills.
§ Established interest in public interest work, reproductive rights issues, and/or impact litigation is a plus, but not mandatory.
§ Sensitivity to and appreciation of diversity within the workforce, including differences in race, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, socioeconomic circumstance, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, and disability, is required.

SALARY 
$105,000, plus comprehensive benefits.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS 
Interested applicants should submit a cover letter and a résumé at the following link: https://jobs.lever.co/ppfa/cd3c88e0-39db-4eeb-8347-1eb97ccee1b4 PPFA is an equal employment opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a nondiscriminatory work environment.

ORGANIZATION TYPE
Nonprofit Organization – General

PRACTICE AREAS 
Constitutional Law/First Amendment, Litigation, Non-Profit, Reproductive Rights

NUMBER OF LAWYERS
16–25

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seek a dynamic and effective Global Advocacy Coordinator. This job reports to the Senior Director, Global Advocacy in the Government Relations Department within the Policy, Campaigns, and Advocacy Division of PPFA and will support the Global Advocacy team in the planning and execution of PPFA’s and Planned Parenthood Global’s work to protect access to international reproductive health and foreign assistance funding through advocacy to country and multilateral bodies, including U.S. foreign policy.
 
Purpose:
 Provide support to the Global Advocacy team in the planning and execution of Planned Parenthood Federation of America’s and Planned Parenthood Global’s work to protect access to international reproductive health and foreign assistance funding through advocacy of country and multilateral bodies, including U.S. foreign policy. This position manages key systems to ensure successful workflow while at the same time tracking essential legislative, policy, and global opposition debates impacting our issues and leading key projects, including around youth engagement on global advocacy priorities. The Global Advocacy Coordinator jumps in to support urgent priorities while keeping track of ongoing, long term work. The Global Advocacy Coordinator interacts diplomatically and enthusiastically with a variety of stakeholders, including colleagues across the organization, coalition partners, supporters, affiliates, and global partners.
 
Delivery:
●      Provides general support towards the effective management of the global advocacy team, including scheduling large meetings and conference calls, processing expenses, and organizing meeting logistics.
●      Helps develop and manage systems to support team workflow, track progress against goals, support donor reporting, and assists in the development of presentations about the work.
●      Tracks legislation, monitors policy debates on international family planning and reproductive health (FP/RH), analyzes opposition activities online and at the United Nations, and regularly conducts online research and prepares summaries in support of the development of advocacy materials.
●      Drafts communications and supports outreach to PPFA affiliates, supporters, and international partners.
●      Responsible for making routine, relatively low-cost expenditures (such as travel, office supplies, or event costs) with prior approval from supervisor or department head.
 
Engagement:
●      Under the leadership of other global advocacy team members and in partnership with the youth organizing team, coordinates the engagement of youth leaders on global advocacy priorities, including overall project management, engaging with coalition partners who prioritize youth engagement and related advocacy, and ongoing coordination with fellows and alumni.
●      Plans events in conjunction with affiliates and partner organizations.
●      Coordinates with international staff and partners to inform and support advocacy efforts.
●      Attends external events and meetings, takes notes, and develops first drafts of priority documents.
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
●      Bachelor’s degree required.
●      2 years of directly-related, progressively responsible administrative support experience with experience in project management preferred.
●      Strong computer skills including word processing, database, spreadsheet and use of the internet.
●      Exceptional attention to detail and ability work independently and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
●      Excellent writing skills, critical thinking, and proactive problem solving skills.
●      Ability to work as part of a team.
●      Intermediate understanding of reproductive health issues, legislative process, U.S. global health programs and international family planning field, and ability to apply that knowledge in professional settings.
●      Strong interpersonal, organization, communication, and customer service skills and the ability to build trust and credibility with internal and external partners.
●      Knowledge of diverse groups, working with a multicultural workforce and sensitivity and appreciation to cultural differences is required.

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seeks a strategic and effective Associate Director, Legislative Affairs. This job reports to the National Director, Legislative Affairs in the Government Relations Department of PPFA.

Purpose : The Associate Director, Legislative Affairs will lead the advancement of select policy positions and legislative issues prioritized by Planned Parenthood Federation of America before the U.S. Congress. The role requires a proactive, detail oriented leader with a proven record of developing and implementing legislative strategies and tactics that will advance PPFA’s goals of increasing access to reproductive health care for women, men and young people by maintaining contact with key staffers and members of Congress. Serves as a resource for PPFA affiliates and internal staff by providing information and support on federal legislation and policy.

Delivery :
●      In collaboration with the National Director of Legislative Affairs, formulate and implement legislative strategy to carry out PPFA’s goals regarding reproductive health policies and programs so members of Congress and the Administration are informed and aware of PPFA’s positions on issues.
●      Responsible for executing lobbying and campaign strategies on a select legislative priorities, including health finance and federal appropriations, in order to increase the visibility and influence of PPFA among Members of Congress, Congressional staff and other federal policy makers and thought leaders.
●      Conduct and coordinate analysis of legislative issues.
●      Serve as a project manager for signature annual events sponsored by PPFA to engage congressional offices related to sexual and reproductive health and rights by collaborating with internal departments, affiliates and coalition partners.
●      Prepare educational materials for Congressional staff such as of Dear Colleague letters, legislation and amendments, fact sheets, and talking points.
●      Ongoing analysis, strong understanding and application of House and Senate procedural rules to inform legislative strategies.
●      Supervising legislative specialist responsible for the monitoring of legislative development and activities in Congress, voting records, internal systems and annual federal filings.
●      Provide PPFA affiliates and staff with the latest information regarding legislative activity and coordinate efforts to mobilize activities in support of PPFA policy positions.
●      Communicates, coordinates, and strategizes with coalition partners, represents PPFA and PPFA’s positions in coalition meetings and works to develop consensus on issues in order to be most effective in lobbying activities.
●      Public presentations and speaking opportunities to key internal and external audiences on PPFA’s lobbying strategy and outcomes.
●      Prepare detailed Congressional target lists to identify members of Congress who need additional information, lobbying, and grassroots activities. Track members position on domestic policy issues and monitor movement.
●      Lead collaborative federal issue campaigns in coordination  with other PPFA departments to mobilize grassroots activities, develop messages and achieve desired goals.
●      As needed, represents Planned Parenthood Action Fund interests before Members of Congress.
●      Completes special projects as assigned and required.

Engagement:
●      Team player with strong interpersonal skills.
●      Ability to work well with senior staff in a professional and congenial manner.
●      Effective communication skills-the ability to build trust and credibility with internal and external partners.
●      Detail oriented, ability to handle multiple tasks and balance several priorities in a fast-paced environment.
●      Critical thinking and proactive problem solving skills.
●      Knowledge of diverse groups, experience working with a multicultural workforce/ setting, and sensitivity and appreciation to cultural difference is essential.
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
●      7 - 10 years of related, progressively responsible work experience and previous experience working on domestic health care policy.
●      Existing and meaningful network of relationships on Capitol Hill and reproductive health community a plus.
●      Working knowledge of federal legislative process, legislative drafting, strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
●      Passion for health care and PPFA’s mission
●      Impeccable verbal and written communication skills
●      Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively
●      Bachelor’s degree is preferred.

PPFA and the Action Fund seek an Assistant General Counsel for a 12 month period. This job reports to the Deputy General Counsel / Director of Advocacy & Political Law in the Office of the General Counsel. As a member of the Office of the General Counsel of the national office of PPFA and the Action Fund (and its related PACs) (collectively, “National Office”), the Assistant General Counsel will assist the Policy, Campaigns, and Advocacy and Communications teams, as well as administrative staff and leadership, by providing first-rate, effective, and reliable legal counsel. Reporting to the Deputy General Counsel / Director of Advocacy and Political Law, the Assistant General Counsel will be directly involved in evaluating, documenting, and assessing the risks of complex transactions, projects, and policy initiatives, in a multitude of advocacy and/or political areas, including, nonprofit tax law, campaign finance law, corporate governance, intellectual property, and fundraising.

Purpose: 
The Assistant General Counsel will:
● Perform regulatory analysis and give oral and written advice, draft compliance guidance, and conduct relevant trainings to ensure that the National Office conducts its business in compliance with all applicable laws, standards, and practices, including federal and state campaign finance laws, lobbying disclosure requirements, gift and ethics rules, and tax laws governing exempt organizations, including, specifically, the operation of affiliated 501(c)(3), 501(c)(4), and 527 organizations.
● Provide counsel and guidance on legal matters and on legal implications of non-legal matters related to the National Office’s major transactions and programs, including contract negotiation and review.
● Support the work of senior attorneys by taking on special projects as needed, including legal research, drafting policies, procedures and guidance to address organizational risk areas.
● Provide advice on other matters requested by the General Counsel and/or Deputy General Counsel.

Delivery: 
The successful candidate should demonstrate the following qualities:
● Exceptional research, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically about both the creative and the execution processes.
● Excellent written and oral communication skills.
● Commitment to providing first-rate and timely legal advice and services to all in-house clients.

Engagement:
The successful candidate should demonstrate the following abilities:
● Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced, highly innovative, and rapidly changing environment.
● Ability to work collaboratively with program and operations teams.
● Strong interpersonal skills.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs): 
Juris Doctor (J.D.) from an accredited U.S. law school.

Bar Admission: Admitted to practice in New York or Washington, D.C. or ability to waive in.

Legal Experience: At least three years of legal experience required. Experience in U.S. not-for-profit corporate and tax matters and/or campaign finance laws preferred. Experience as in-house counsel or as an attorney for a relevant regulator is a plus.

Travel: 0-10%. If telecommuter, there is an expectation for travel to D.C. or NY at least once a quarter.

Salary Range: $100,000-$140,000 commensurate with experience

The People & Culture division is a critical partner focused on delivering a progressive people agenda that attracts, develops, and retains top talent and provides them with a great place to work.

Purpose


      • In this role we are looking for a self-starter who has a passion for transforming complex systems and processes. The ideal candidate will rapidly develop a point of view on the existing platforms, the underlying capabilities, both deployed and available via upgrades, connect with internal and external resources to gain deep understanding of the underlying issues while developing and piloting solutions to accomplish the team’s goals. S(h)e is driven to get it right the first time, thinks logically but doesn’t allow convention to get in the way of a bold, new idea. While helping the team transition into in-system processes, the Senior Specialist, PCSS also manages all incoming service requests as they relate to the employee database with the idea of fully automating all transactions.

Engagement


      • The Senior Specialist, PCSS will collaborate with stakeholders across the P&C Centers of Excellence, and the People & Culture Business Partners (PCBPs) to gain the understanding and insights necessary to develop and implement the project portfolio of Shared Services. Furthermore, the Senior Specialist, PCSS works in tandem with the team’s analytics lead to ensure that all records in the employee database are accurate and all transactions are processed in adherence to the team’s SLAs. S(h)e will also collaborate with external consultants and vendor representatives to investigate system capabilities, resolve issues and manage the implementation lifecycle.

    • Create employee profiles for new hires in employee database
    • Track and monitor service levels against service level agreements

    • Manage the PCSS project cycle and provide change management support
    • Identify process gaps and engage in process analysis, mapping and design to further refine the Shared Service model
    • Maintain data integrity and act as point of contact for any audits

      • System Upgrades/Maintenance:
    • Evaluate and deploy system interfaces with other solutions across the PPFA IT landscape
    • Evaluate all available feature upgrades and system capabilities and develop a point of view on improvements to PCSS services and client experience

      • Special Projects as Assigned

    • Driven to succeed and committed to deliver a high quality “wow”  product every time

job_html:
Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. 

For 50 years, Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) has been working overseas to ensure that people across the globe have access to the health care they need to control their bodies and their futures. Planned Parenthood Global, the international division of PPFA, believes all people should have access to reproductive health care, no matter where they live. By partnering with local advocates, medical service providers, and youth leaders, and helping to build sustainable networks and organizations, we find innovative ways to expand access to critical services and fight for more inclusive laws and policies.

job_html:
Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. 

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) seeks a Vice President, Development, Principal and Major Gifts. This job reports to the Chief Development Officer in the Development Division of PPFA.

Purpose:
The Vice President (VP), Principal and Major Gifts (PMG) leads the work of the PMG team to raise the necessary revenue to execute the strategic priorities of Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA), Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF), Planned Parenthood Votes (PPVotes), and the Planned Parenthood Federal PAC (PPFedPAC). The PMG portfolio is composed of high-net-worth individual donors and families capable of making gifts of $25,000 or more with an emphasis on relationship building to grow gifts and pledges to six, seven, and eight-figure gifts. As a member of the Senior Development Leadership Team (SDLT), the VP, PMG has a deep personal commitment to, and understanding of diversity, equity, and inclusion, and uses that as a frame to lead PMG and influence the direction of the division overall. 

Delivery
Provide world-class leadership to a team of 30+ fundraising professionals to raise annual and multi-year major and principal level gifts from high-net-worth individuals and families in support of the work of PPFA, PPAF, PPVotes, and the PPFedPAC, totaling close to $80 million annually.
 
Set strategic direction for fundraising plans for principal and major gifts, including:
●        Ongoing evaluation of team structure to ensure adequate staffing resources to grow revenue and relationships with high-net-worth donors and prospects. Continuous career development of staff to maintain opportunity pipelines for promising talent.
●        Ensure continuous improvement in processes and procedures to set budgets, forecast revenue against budget targets, and in ongoing pipeline development and monitoring.
●        Expand the number of diverse donors in the principal and major gift portfolio.
●        Oversee the ongoing stewardship of major and principal donors including Leadership Council programming, special Campaign recognition programs, Leadership Briefing calls, and other projects.
●        Ensure political fundraising plans are in compliance with state and federal election laws.
Create a learning environment for staff that prioritizes professional development and growth within the parameters of business needs. Promote a staff culture of feedback and accountability, model multi-directional feedback, and uplift work-life balance, safety, healing, and wellness in working relationships.
●        Recruit, develop, and retain staff from diverse backgrounds that will enhance PPFA’s ability to attract donors. Recruit, mentor, and manage staff fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous learning, and commitment to organizational values which include equity, justice, and anti-racism principles, by setting and modeling effective leadership practices, providing regular feedback, and supporting career development opportunities.
●        Align structure to help support team members’ understanding of how their individual roles, roles of their teams, and the overall PMG team contribute to the success of PPFA’s development efforts.
●        Serve as a role model for accountability with regard to team agreements.
Partner with Senior Development Leadership Team (SDLT) members to successfully plan and execute a capital campaign to fund organizational priorities. 
●        Work with frontline PMG fundraisers to develop a robust pipeline of donor prospects capable of making philanthropic investments at the $1 million+ level.
Serve as a thought-leader for Planned Parenthood’s development program at the national office and 49 affiliates, including active participation with the Development Officers Council (DOC) affiliate membership organization.
Expand the PMG partnership with 8 affiliates in the Collaborative Fundraising Program (CFP), focusing on collaboration among PPFA frontline fundraising team members and CFP affiliate frontline team members to establish donor strategies that will yield maximum revenue and deepen the relationship between the donor and the Planned Parenthood movement.

Engagement:
This position interacts with internal and external leaders and must have exceptional leadership and influencing skills. The Principal and Major Gifts team includes more than 30 staff members organized among a frontline fundraising team, a political fundraising team, and an operations team. Other constituents include PMG donors and prospects; PPFA/PPAF senior leaders; Planned Parenthood affiliate CEOs and CDOs; and PPFA, PPAF, and affiliate board members.
PMG team staff members are based in the New York City, Washington, D.C., and San Francisco offices, as well as telecommuters.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
 ●        Deep personal commitment to Planned Parenthood’s mission and values. Knowledge of relevant issues regarding sexual and reproductive health services, education, and advocacy.
●        Unimpeachable integrity and high ethical standards; mature judgment in handling sensitive information. Servant leader who is values-driven, committed to personal and professional development, and leads by example. Elevates institutional goals and values beyond personal gain.
●        Deep understanding of the connections between power; racial, sexual, economic, and gender inequity; and the intersection with reproductive justice. Applies strategies to address how race and gender dynamics impact supervisory relationships, organizational culture, partnerships, campaigns and coalition work, and can demonstrate a history of successfully intervening in problematic dynamics and deepening a racial justice approach within an organization, team, or campaign.
●        Open and transparent communication style and experience giving, taking, and implementing feedback. Demonstrated contribution toward a positive workplace culture and a feeling of welcoming and belonging for all staff.
●        Superb written and verbal communication skills, with the presence, demeanor, sense of humor, and comfort level to serve as an inspiring, highly visible ambassador of Planned Parenthood.
●        Extensive knowledge of individual donor fundraising, including industry standards and best practices.
●        Empathetic leadership style for managing complex personnel situations and building strong relationships.
●        Leading a team by prioritizing inclusivity and bringing an equity lens to decision-making.
●        An emotionally intelligent, values- and results-driven leader who can positively influence staff and collaborate across departments and at all levels of the organization, and provide feedback and coaching to support the achievement of complex goals. Highly skilled communicator, both individually and in large audiences or public communications.
●        Commitment to the professional development of team members.
●        Strategic thinker that can translate strategy into actionable plans.
●        Ability to analyze data to make effective, efficient decisions about donor strategy and process.
●        Forward thinker with a track record of utilizing new methods of donor engagement and connectivity, who will be driven by innovation in developing philanthropic best practices in the current and post-COVID-19 world.
●        Ability to function in a rapidly changing environment with shifting priorities.
●        Commitment to integrating the principles of community-centric fundraising in order to strengthen the organization’s fundraising program.
●        Ability to travel, consistent with public health guidelines.

Experience
●        Successful track record of personally cultivating, soliciting, and stewarding major and principal gifts from individual and institutional donors at the level of six to seven-figures and greater. Strength in prospect discovery and in building effective strategies to compel new major donor investment.
●        Substantial management experience and demonstrated ability to establish, lead, and drive objectives – particularly in a highly dynamic and evolving environment – while operationalizing equity and setting an equity and justice-rooted strategy for advancement. 
●        Proven ability to work with multi-racial, multi-ethnic, multi-gendered, intergenerational teams and workforces. Significant experience leading a team that centers inclusivity and consensus or other participatory decision-making models. Familiarity with Black Feminist Praxis framework a plus.
●        Experience fundraising for advocacy/electoral priorities and in a rapid response environment.
●        Experience navigating challenging donor conversations.
●        Demonstrated experience working collaboratively with senior-level colleagues, board members, and leadership volunteers on successful development-related activities.
●        Experience working in a federated/networked organization.

Purpose : The purpose of the Manager of Gift Planning, Life Income Gifts, is to add value and expertise to the successful life income gift program of the national organization and our affiliate partners participating in the program.  This staff member will work with the Senior Director of Gift Planning, Gifts & Systems, and the Associate Director of Gift Planning, Life Income Gifts, to manage the internal and external gift administration process, reporting, and financial tracking of the program’s charitable gift annuities, charitable remainder trusts, and pooled income fund.

●      Handles the closure of annuity, trust, and pooled income fund accounts as gifts are severed or mature.  Ensures the timely distribution of proceeds to affiliates. 
●      Produces the annual reports, including calculations, for participants in the Pooled Income Fund and Charitable Remainder Trust program. 
●      Builds knowledge in gift planning and gift administration through self-study and formal training—including a focus on taxation, changes in the law, and the updating of software tools. 
●      Attends a variety of weekly, monthly, and periodic meetings, as well as organizational trainings, with an emphasis on building diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization and among our supporters.

About this role: The Senior Digital Product Designer will champion our users’ need for sexual and reproductive health care that meets their lived experiences by strategically designing the integrated user experience across multiple products. The Senior Digital Product Designer will report to the National Director, Digital Products.

Purpose: The Senior Digital Product Designer will be successful when they: 1) independently research and identify our target users’ core needs within the health care and education journey, 2) manage the product design process to deliver user experience strategy and design across multiple digital products, and 3) collaborate across multiple interdisciplinary product teams to iteratively launch new user experiences.

Delivery :
The Senior Digital Product Designer is responsible for iteratively planning and delivering the following bodies of work across two or more digital products concurrently:
 
●      Information Architecture - High-level IA Models that organize the structure and relationship of content to match natural user categorizations (e.g., site maps, service blueprints).
●      User Research - Leading product level research, and identifying collaboration points across teams.
○      Write user research and testing plans - These should help define themes of product research, and how we will execute them.
○      In person user engagement - Maintaining a regular cadence of in person as well as remote user engagement to ensure we are understanding our users on a 1 to 1 level in order to better empathize and center our designs around their lived experiences.
○      Synthesis - Distill insights into an easily digestible format for working teams to understand our areas of opportunity.
●      User Experience Design - Defining UX on a product level and integrating across teams.
○      Data driven personas - To empower teams to better relate to our target users alongside their healthcare journey.
○      Patient journey map - Centering all of our digital products in the context of the patients ongoing and evolving journey to navigate the complex healthcare space.
○      Logic flows - Mapping easily understood flows around how Planned Parenthood’s content is served up based off user interaction with our digital products.
○      Wireflows - To demonstrate the structural screen to screen interaction on how a user navigates through all parts of a feature or experience.
○      Product copy - Directional guidance for stakeholders and collaborators to work on effective product copy focused improving user engagement.
●      Visual Design - Pushing the collaborative evolution of design patterns and themes.
○      Visual designs and assets - For max and min states, both UI elements, as well as supporting visual components.
●      Interaction Design - Leading cross product evolution of IXD patterns.
○      Prototypes and motion tests - That enable users and product teams to better understand how proposed features will look, work, and feel before investment is made into development.
●      Product design socialization  - Leading cross product evolution of IXD patterns.
○      Design thinking - Be a champion for design thinking and human-centered digital innovation within Digital Products as well as with the broader Planned Parenthood Federation.
○      Research socialization - Report on regular user research to deepen the DP’s understanding of our core audience and their needs, and incorporate learnings into both new and existing products.
○      Mentorship - Help mentor less experienced designers through honest, constructive, actionable feedback, and offer guidance to peers.
 
 
Engagement:
 
●      Strategic thought leader and influencer among interdisciplinary peers on scrum teams
●      Advisor and thought partner to peers and more senior colleagues within PPFA and at affiliates
●      Mentorship and support to more junior peers

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
 
Required professional experience:
 
●      4 years' expertise in designing and launching scalable end-to-end digital experiences.
●      Has shipped multiple products.
●      Strong product design portfolio with an emphasis on minimalism and clarity across a diverse mix of digital formats, including websites, and mobile apps.
●   Strong UI design skills, with experience building and implementing design systems alongside engineering.
●     Extensive experience with a variety of design tools, including (but not limited to) Figma, Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, and online prototyping tools like Principal.
●      A working knowledge on how digital products are structured and built on the technical end, so that designs are created with proper structure and development lift in mind.
●      Experience working with brand standards.
●     Extensive experience designing, conducting, and synthesizing user research, utilizing a variety of methodologies and recruiting specific demographics.
 
Required attributes:
 
●      Systems thinker with one eye always on improving the larger picture through efficient design solutions that responsively adapt to platforms, users, and situations
●      Strong empathy for the user and a passion for designing for social impact
●      Passion for Planned Parenthood’s mission, and dedication to using technology to expand access to the sexual and reproductive health resources and rights
●      Knowledge of current design and research best practices and patterns, and enthusiasm for seeking and investigating new patterns, practices and tools.
●      Comfort with context switching and changing priorities, and patience for process
●      Able to think strategically, learn quickly, and succeed in fast-paced and uncertain environments
●      Able to function effectively as a team player while leading organizational change
●      Goal-oriented; able to make demonstrable progress toward strategic goals and KPls, while keeping up with an ever-evolving day-to-day product development environment

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF)seek an Associate Director of Evaluation for the Black Health Equity Initiative (BHEI).  In April 2022, PPFA’s Board of Directors established a Black Health Equity Fund, allocating Mackenzie Scott’s $50M gift to this Fund. PPFA will  partner with leaders across the Federation to co-create a Black Health Equity Initiative (BHEI) that will establish a Black patient-centered model that achieves one or more demonstrable improvements in health equity for Black patients at/via Planned Parenthood.
This job reports to the Director of Evaluation and Learning in the Research and Evaluation Department of PPFA. The Research and Evaluation Department consists of a team of epidemiologists, evaluators, and clinical research experts that conducts and supports research and evaluation throughout the federation. The department aims to expand health care options and improve access to critical services and new ways of delivering care. To this end, the department conducts original research studies to inform patient care and assesses the effectiveness of National Office programs and initiatives. The department also facilitates, coordinates, and supports research conducted at Planned Parenthood affiliates through capacity building, technical assistance, and direct consultation.

Purpose :
The Associate Director will design, lead and manage a robust, multi-pronged evaluation of a new initiative to advance health equity of Black patients, staff, and communities served by Planned Parenthood. The Black Health Equity Initiative (BHEI) aims to transform the reproductive health care field and advance reproductive health equity by co-creating a sustainable and scalable model between affiliates and community leaders to design community-driven approaches, improving health equity and reducing sexual and reproductive health disparities. The main focus of this position is to provide oversight, coordination, and technical assistance for monitoring and evaluation of programs and interventions that will comprise the BHEI. The Associate Director will lead the evaluation design, data collection and analysis, monitoring, reporting and dissemination, applying health equity and culturally responsive evaluation models.

-        Communicates regularly with internal stakeholders across departments and divisions within the National Office.
-        Serves as an internal evaluation expert to the BHEI

-        Develops, implements and oversees the collection of process, outcome, and impact evaluation data
-        Works closely with research/evaluation and program staff to ensure coordinated communication
-        Schedules and facilitates meetings with internal and external stakeholders; ensures content and logistics are covered for evaluation meetings.
-        Summarizes and disseminates evaluation findings and project results to internal audiences, including preparation of reports, publications, and presentations.
-        Supports the development of external evaluation-based reporting as needed.
-        Performs other evaluation duties as assigned.

-        Bachelor's degree required. Master's degree in a related subject preferred.  Combination of professional experience and skills will be considered in lieu of formal/traditional education.
-        Five years experience of directly related, progressively responsible research and/or evaluation experience in partnership with Black patients, participants and/or communities
-        Experience with direct implementation of evaluation activities, including design, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

-        Possesses a deep understanding of the ways that racism, white supremacy and white supremacy culture in this country perpetuate race-based disparities; understands the history and enduring impact of racism and reproductive coercion in the field of sexual and reproductive health, including in evaluation tools and processes

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. 

The Education & Training Department supports the organizational mission to provide care, no matter what, by driving education, learning, and engagement. Through work with affiliates and other departments at the national office, this team helps people access sex education, receive sexual and reproductive health information and care, and engage with Planned Parenthood in the ways that best serve them. The Department of Education and Training works with all Planned Parenthood affiliates to strengthen their Education & Training programs and evaluation, supports the internal development of innovative approaches to digital sex education, collaborates with other departments to conduct large-scale media and social marketing campaigns, leads federal, state and local efforts to advance sex education, provides adult learning theory-driven training support throughout the organization, and participates in research and evaluation efforts to determine the efficacy and effectiveness of key affiliate and national office programs and interventions.
 
Purpose:
Reporting to the National Director, Employee Engagement, a successful Employee Engagement (EXX) Specialist will support the team’s ability to provide human-centered, employee-focused projects, products, and programs in the following ways: creation of robust project timelines, coordination of training logistics and pre- and post-program communications, enhancing the team presence on our employee-facing intranet site, and instructional design support.
 
Delivery:
●      Recommend processes and procedures to support efficiency and consistency in production and delivery of work.
 
●      Project coordination support for learning programs, including: draft project plans in chosen project management software for all EXX projects. Discuss project timelines and milestones with the team, and ensure that project deliverables are met on time.
 
●      Organize training logistics for all Employee Engagement Programs in collaboration with Employee Engagement Managers.
 
●      Provide design support and assist in creative instructional design to support the departmental goal of the creation of engaging learning solutions.
 
●      Arrange and collaborate with the National Director of Employee Engagement and Employee Engagement Managers on seasonal efforts such as goals, workforce, and budget planning.
 
●      Tracks and processes pay orders, and invoices for Employee Engagement Team projects. Prepares, distributes, and submits invoices for meetings and related expenditures. Monitors EXX team budget.
 
●      Manages logistical and technical support of virtual meetings, maximizing user experience by providing interactivity and tools for ongoing virtual offerings.
 
●      Support in-person meetings (when travel restrictions are lifted) by identifying space, setting up video conferences and/or planning meetings, and collecting and distributing relevant materials.
 
●      Lead the preparation and editing of agendas for both virtual and in-person meetings.
 
●      Develop and launch communication vehicles such as newsletters, surveys, etc., to support engagement and transparency between the EXX team, Affiliates, and  National Office by taking the creative lead (with input from EXX staff).
 
●      Schedules team meetings, and assists in managing the National Director’s calendar as requested.
 
●      Provides support for program initiatives, project planning, and planning of events for affiliate and national staff. Assists in creating, compiling, and editing ad hoc reports and presentations.
 
●      Completes special projects as assigned and required.

Engagement:
●      Track action items and work with leaders across departments to ensure follow-up is completed.
 
●      Technology producer for small and large group learning opportunities for the employee engagement team.
 
●      Schedules and Plans EXX Team Retreats, agenda drafting, and intended retreat outcomes.
 
●      Arranges for affiliate visits by EXX staff, including coordination with affiliates, booking and coordinating travel logistics, and developing agendas for meetings.
 
●      Conduct all duties with a very strong customer service focus to internal and external customers utilizing the organization’s In This Together Workplace Values and Service Standards.
 

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs):
 
●      Knowledge of Google plus, Asana, or other project coordination tools, computer literacy
●      Working knowledge and interest in Employee Engagement, well-being & Workplace Culture.
●      Computer literacy, including knowledge of how to update intranet content, MS-PowerPoint, MS-Excel, and MS-Word.
●      Knowledge of Instructional Design Methodologies (i.e., ADDIE) and Adult Learning Theory.
●      Attention to detail and experience organizing work (i.e., outlines, online folders, agenda creation)
●      Customer Service Orientation
●      Understanding of Human-Centered Design that prioritizes the voices of marginalized community members.
●      Reliable and conscientious
●      Takes initiative (i.e., provides ideas for how to improve how Employee Engagement Team creates and monitors project tasks, makes recommendations  for how Employee Engagement Team creates documents with a consistent look and feel)
 
TRAVEL: occasional (following the COVID travel ban, travel could be up to 15% to support in-person training, etc.)
Starting salary: $60K

We also offer voluntary opt in for Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Transportation/Commuter accounts.
