job_html:
Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. 

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) seeks a grounded and innovative Manager of Digital Education. This job reports to the Director of Digital Education & Learning Strategy in the Education & Training Department of PPFA.

The Education & Training Department supports the organizational mission to provide care, no matter what, by driving education, learning, and engagement. Through work with affiliates and other departments at the national office, this team helps people access sex education, receive sexual and reproductive health information and care, and engage with Planned Parenthood in the ways that best serve them. The Department of Education and Training works with all Planned Parenthood affiliates to strengthen their Education & Training programs and evaluation, supports the internal development of innovative approaches to digital sex education, collaborates with other departments to conduct large scale media and social marketing campaigns, leads federal, state and local efforts to advance sex education, provides adult learning theory-driven training support throughout the organization, and participates in research and evaluation efforts to determine the efficacy and effectiveness of key affiliate and national office programs and interventions.
 
Purpose:The Manager of Digital Education will be successful when national health messaging is medically accurate, sex-positive, socially and culturally relevant, rooted in equity and inclusion, consistent across channels, informed by scientific evidence and behavior change theory, and helps people learn what they need to in order to improve their sexual and reproductive health throughout the lifespan.
 
Delivery:
●      Partner on the creation, updating, and maintenance of health education content for plannedparenthood.org, all PPFA communications and social content across channels, educational videos, and digital education and health programs by securing collaboration with the Communications and Culture and Digital Products teams to set objectives and strategies and approve content:
○      Partner on chat programs (Roo chatbot and live Chat/Text program) by reviewing new and updated answers/messages, reviewing data and chat transcripts for quality assurance and program improvement, as well as provide thought partnership on design updates, product feature development, and strategic direction
○      Partner on quiz updating and development, to provide users with personalized information to guide them through sexual and reproductive health decision making
○      Partner on social media content by reviewing all health-related social media posts for accuracy, health literacy, and alignment with sex education and public health best practices
○      Partner on brand observances (Let’s Talk Month, Cervical Health Awareness Month, STI Awareness Month, etc.) to help guide strategic focus and direction, and content review (talking points, graphics, etc.)
○      Partner on website content, particularly Ask the Experts and the PP Blog, including content brainstorming and prioritization, and content review.
○      Partner with Editorial and the Video team on educational video development.
●      Support the Director of Digital Education & Learning Strategy on new digital education initiatives, such as ways to engage in the metaverse, or ways PP can build engagement and community with a new generation of teens via digital education
●      Improve the accuracy, consistency, and educational value of PPFA online content, products, videos, and social media messaging;
●      Communicate and translate complex sex education and sexual and reproductive health care subject matters to various audiences in an understandable and actionable manner
●      Provide proactive, holistic thought leadership and guidance to internal stakeholders for content, campaigns, and product development that centers sex education, behavior change theory, and equity
●        Keep abreast of sexual and reproductive health research to integrate timely updates and best practices into new and existing sex education content and products
●      Serve as the PP representative on the Sex Education Collaborative communications work group, and member of the planning group for Sex Ed for All Month
●      Other duties as assigned
 
Engagement:
●      Provide context and information about reproductive and sexual health issues to enhance the scope of all educational content across PPFA, with a specific lens to ensuring materials are inclusive of gender, sexual orientation, language of origin, race/ethnicity/culture, and other identities.
●      Secure collaboration on health media planning and product development and represent Education throughout project execution processes to ensure alignment with learning strategy and departmental goals
●      Provide subject matter expertise to ensure high standards and consistency of health messaging through diverse channels of communication by:
○      Securing collaboration and maintaining productive partnerships with Digital Products, Brand, Editorial, Social Media, and Creative teams
○      Persuading and influencing internal and external stakeholders in the creation of unbiased, useful, and inclusive content and projects across all external facing educational communications and products
●      Represent Planned Parenthood as a leader in sex education via promotion of our innovative digital products and publications at national conferences and meetings, as well as presenting our work in public forums including webinars and at national conferences and meetings
 
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
●      Master’s degree in public health or related field, or 5 years relevant experience
●      Demonstrated expertise in sexual and reproductive health and behavior change and learning theories
●      Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including highly developed editing skills
●      Ability to translate clinical guidelines and medical and public health research into plain language according to health literacy best practices
●      Strong understanding of institutional and interpersonal systems of oppression and ability to utilize a reproductive justice lens and intersectional framework into content development
●      Understanding of adolescent development and ability to discern age appropriate messaging for children, adolescents, young adults, parents/caregivers, sex educators, and the general public.
●        Collaborative work style; able to persuade and secure agreement amongst diverse communities and individuals
●        Experience with digital sex education and/or sexual and reproductive health content development
●      Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously and prioritize appropriately. Able to effectively balance and execute against competing priorities while maintaining outstanding work product(s)
●      Ability to read and write in Spanish, preferred
 
 
TRAVEL: 0-25%
Starting salary: $83K

job_html:
Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. 

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fundseeks a dynamic and collaborative Manager, Data Analytics. This job reports to the Associate Director, Abortion Access Analytics in the Data Strategy, Analytics, and Governance (DSAG) department at PPFA. The DSAG team enables data-driven decision making through high quality data, analysis, and tools. 

Purpose:
The Manager contributes to Planned Parenthood’s mission by leveraging critical health care data and leading the collection and analysis of data to understand the impact of services and programs, such as abortion access. As a member of PPFA’s DSAG team, the Manager will produce dashboards, analysis, and other customized data visualizations, provide technical support for data quality assurance (QA) processes, and develop analytic tools and documentation for Planned Parenthood’s national office and affiliate stakeholders. They will establish strong relationships across departments and provide exemplary customer service by understanding stakeholder needs and proposing targeted, sustainable data solutions. This role requires strong analytical skills, a clear understanding of data structures, and close attention to detail.

Delivery:
 The Manager will be responsible for the following:
●      Develop and conduct targeted analytics, including data visualizations, dashboards, decks, recommendations, and reports, in support of programs and stakeholders;
●      Leverage a wide variety of data sources and for end-users with various levels of data literacy
●      Assist in technical database designs, and planning and managing the integration of novel datasets
●      Develop work plans and manage projects within and across teams to ensure timely delivery of analytic products
●      Participate in quality assurance (QA) processes to ensure data products are high quality
●      Convene and consult with national office and affiliate stakeholders on data collection, analysis, and reporting to inform analyses; provide subject matter expertise and technical assistance to create and improve data practices, analyses, and tools
●      Provide technical support for analytic and ad-hoc data requests from colleagues across the Federation and for abortion access-related work as necessary
●      Document data products and systems: author wiki articles and internal process documents; develop user-facing guides (written and video)
●      Effectively manage program/project files (organize, archive) in alignment with DSAG’s knowledge management practices
●      Demonstrate intercultural competence and ensure all work products consider the impacts of the work on multiple communities, including communities of color and individuals with different gender identities and socioeconomic backgrounds
●      Pursue relevant proficiencies/certifications where determined by business needs
●      Perform other duties as assigned

Engagement:
 The Manager’s primary portfolio will focus on the data collection and analysis of multiple data resources, technical support to stakeholders, and streamlined, secure, and efficient access to analysis for national office teams and affiliates. The role requires strong interpersonal skills and enthusiasm for helping others collect, leverage, and interpret data. The manager may also support other related programs/projects within DSAG’s workplan. The Manager will consult regularly with end-users at the national office and affiliates to develop targeted data solutions that inform operational and strategic decision-making. This role will provide ongoing technical support, education, and mentorship on data tools, analytic methods, and best practices.
 
This position requires a keen ability and desire to communicate, including attending and presenting at cross-divisional meetings/webinars. The Manager will regularly interact with partners and other teams at the national office, and must be able to effectively distill complex information and data concepts to executive audiences or non-technical audiences. Due to the consultative nature of the role, the Manager must have exemplary customer service skills, a positive “can do” attitude, and a demonstrated track record directly helping people design and implement data products and systems. The Manager will have familiarity and experience working with the population Planned Parenthood serves, including people of different racial, ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds, people with different gender identities and individuals with disabilities.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
 
Required
●      At least 3-5 years of experience in healthcare analysis/business intelligence, public health, statistics, or related area
●      Experience in disaggregating data and considering the impacts on multiple communities, including communities of color, in technical analysis
●      Experience developing written technical documentation
●      Experience with SQL/T-SQL, Python, or R for complex querying, data cleaning, statistical analysis, and applications
●      At least one Tableau Desktop certification or willingness to become certified within three months of date of hire
●      Experience working both independently and in coordination with multiple teams
●      Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills with keen attention to detail and grammar (English fluency); ability to flex communication style to multiple cultural environments
●      Knowledge of and sensitivity to different racial/ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds, and people with different gender identities, cultural differences and disabilities
●      Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferred; combination of professional experience and skills may be considered in lieu of formal/traditional education
 
Highly Preferred
●      Experience with healthcare data, including writing complex SQL reports using electronic health records (EHR) reporting databases (NextGen, Epic Clarity/Caboodle, Athena, eCW)
●      Experience with databases and data migration projects
●      Advanced Microsoft Excel proficiency
●      Experience with ETL, data integration, analytics tools, such as Alteryx or Tableau Prep
●      Proficiency with G-Suite and Microsoft Office suite required; experience with Asana or similar project management tool
 
 
TRAVEL: 0-25% (domestic)
Starting salary: $85K

job_html:
Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) is the national umbrella organization for the nation’s leading network of women’s health care providers, educators, and advocates, serving women, men, teens and families. For over 100 years, Planned Parenthood has done more than any other organization in the United States to improve women’s health and safety, prevent unintended pregnancies, and advance the right and ability of individuals and families to make informed and responsible health care decisions. Planned Parenthood Action Fund (PPAF) is the advocacy and political arm of PPFA. 

Planned Parenthood Federation of America (PPFA) and Planned Parenthood Action Fund seek an ambitious and highly-organized Administration & Projects Senior Specialist. This job reports to the National Director, Data Strategy, Analytics, and Governance in the Data Strategy, Analytics, and Governance (DSAG) department at PPFA. The DSAG team enables data-driven decision making through high quality data, analysis, and tools. 

Purpose:
 The Senior Specialist provides administrative and project support to DSAG’s National Director, leadership team, and department. While a majority of the role will be administrative, the role will have opportunities to lead project-based work, including supporting the data analytics workstream associated with PPFA’s abortion access crisis response. Because this role is embedded on PPFA’s data team, the Senior Specialist will have broad exposure to data systems and platforms.
 
Delivery:
Administrative
●      Monitor and triage the DSAG inbox and/or other request queues as needed, coordinating with DSAG leadership team to assign-out new inquiries and tasks
●      Coordinate partner intake, contracting, and bids/RFPs for DSAG’s new and existing vendors (e.g. Tableau)
●      Provide administrative support to National Director as needed, including calendar management and expense management
●      Provide meeting support, including: preparing and sending materials (agendas, decks, pre-reads), taking/disseminating meeting notes, recording/managing action items
●      Assist with planning and coordinating staff development programming, such as health equity and leadership initiatives
●      Coordinate logistics for meetings, events, and trainings (both on-site and off-site)
●      Assist National Director in preparing updates for leadership teams and key stakeholders
●      Manage DSAG department administrative resources, including document templates, one-pagers, presentations, org chart, and other collateral
●      Assist with technology user request management, such as creating new user accounts in Tableau
●      Track DSAG department’s progress on strategic work plans
●      Author and manage DSAG’s knowledge management resources, including policy/process/procedure documents; assist with managing Confluence or other team wiki site
●      Other duties as assigned
Project Support
●      Serve as the lead administrative support for the abortion access crisis data workstream, under the direction of the National Director
●      Spearhead new projects as requested by the DSAG leadership team
●      Manage and maintain Asana and/or Jira projects, including updating/curating tasks, authoring status updates, and following-up with assignees on progress
●      Support the DSAG team’s adoption of an Agile development methodology, including participating in scrum ceremonies as appropriate
 
Engagement:
 The Senior Specialist supports a broad portfolio of work, and the role requires strong organizational and interpersonal skills and enthusiasm for driving toward success. This role requires a keen ability and desire to communicate and work productively within a team, as well as work across other divisions to build collaborative working relationships. The position will take direction from stakeholders across the PPFA National Office and will work closely with outside vendors.
 
Due to the dynamic, fast-paced nature of the role and organization, the Senior Specialist must have exemplary customer service skills and a positive “can do” attitude. The Senior Specialist will have familiarity and experience working with the population Planned Parenthood serves, including people of different racial, ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds, people with different gender identities and individuals with disabilities.
 
Note: During peak times, the Senior Specialist may be asked to support critical and fast-paced work that may require off-hours availability. We expect these instances will be rare.
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):
Education:
●      Bachelor's degree or equivalent preferred; combination of professional experience and skills may be considered in lieu of formal/traditional education
Required:
●      3 years of experience providing direct administrative and/or project coordination support
●      Impeccable organizational skills, including file/document management
●      Meticulous written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills with keen attention to detail and grammar (English fluency); ability to flex communication style to multiple cultural environments and ability to present to diverse audiences, specifically racially, ethnically, and socioeconomically diverse communities
●      Able to identify issues and implement solutions in a professional, conﬁdential and sensitive manner
●      Collaborative and adaptable work style, including strong interpersonal skills, high emotional intelligence, and a positive can-do attitude
●      Highly proficient in G-Suite and Microsoft Office
●      Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets
●      Excellent analytical skills with sharp attention to detail
●      Proficient in Asana or similar task management software (e.g. Jira, Monday, Basecamp, Trello)
●      Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and respond quickly to changes to the plan;
●      Ability to work independently and prioritize multiple concurrent tasks/projects
●      Experience and comfort working with remote teams, including use of team collaboration tools (e.g. Slack, Google Chat, etc.)
●      Knowledge of and sensitivity to different racial/ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds, and people with different gender identities, cultural differences and disabilities
Preferred:
●      Interest in data, analytics, systems, and technology with a logical/systems mindset
●      Experience with Atlassian Tool suite (Jira, Confluence) and/or project planning software (e.g. Primavera P6, Microsoft Project, etc.) in an Agile environment
●      Exposure to visual design practices and/or tools (e.g. Adobe InDesign)
●      Experience using diagramming tools, such as Microsoft Vizio or LucidChart
●      Experience developing written technical process documentation
 
Note: Applicants for this role will be asked to complete 2-3 interviews and a skills assessment.
 
TRAVEL: 0-10% (domestic) This is a full-time telecommuter position. If the successful candidate lives within the NYC metropolitan area, they will have the option to work from our NYC office.
Starting salary: $76K
